[[File:Bozo (old).gif]]
sounds: Come chat with ol' Bozo!

Tolkien's novel [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings The Lord of The Rings], where Frodo and Sam are the main plot characters. Reaching H.L. requires a long trip and used to be dangerous (in the event of [[luring|lured monsters]]). H.L. doesn't pay you incredibly well, but he buys many [[items]] that cannot be sold at any other [[Shops|shop]], although most of those items are more profitable selling to other players.
H.L. seems to be especially hostile to [[female]]s, in earlier times he even refused to trade with them. In earlier times, people only used to come to him to sell [[Scale Armor]]s, but when these could eventually also be sold to other, more nearby [[Weapon Shopkeeper NPCs]], he became more and more lonely. Another cause of this is that the [[items]] he buys aren't well paid for. For example, he buys [[Demon Armor]]s, [[Dragon Scale Mail]]s and [[Magic Plate Armor]]s for less than 1000 [[gps]]. He even buys the legendary [[Blessed Shield]] for a mere 650 [[gps]]!
name: H.L.

notes:
In life he was known as Tylaf, an apprentice of [[Hjaern]]. He was tortured to death by the [[Cult]]ists but his soul remains.
{{JSpoiler| Part of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].
The first time you visit it you can't speak to it so just take the paper and go back to the shaman, after being granted the power to speak you must say: '''story''' to it in order to proceed.}}

notes:
Markwin is the ruler of [[Mintwallin]].
{{warning|The first time you say 'hi' to him, he will summon 2 [[Minotaur Guard]]s, 2 [[Minotaur Mage]]s and 4 [[Minotaur Archer]]s.}} You can talk with him from outside of the building, so you can avoid standing within the spawn. You must kill the spawn nevertheless afterwards since '''Markwin''' will abrupt the conversation before you can say anything. You shouldn't end a conversation with 'bye' or 'farewell'. '''Markwin''' will answer "Go to hell! Burn!" and set you on [[burning|fire]] resulting in an overall loss of 200 hitpoints. Aside from a small group of outcasts, '''Markwin''' claims to be king of all [[minotaurs]]. He has never fully recovered from an encounter with a [[Dragon]]. His son's name is [[Ian]]. Protected by a large labyrinth, the [[minotaurs]] in [[Mintwallin]] have been largely undisturbed in their underground community. '''Markwin''' wrote a series of five [[Book]]s, namely the Chronicles of Mintwallin [[Chronicle of Mintwallin I (Book)|I]], [[Chronicle of Mintwallin II (Book)|II]], [[Chronicle of Mintwallin III (Book)|III]], [[Chronicle of Mintwallin IV (Book)|IV]] and [[Chronicle of Mintwallin V (Book)|V]].
{{JSpoiler| Part of the [[Postman Missions Quest]].
Part of [[What a Foolish Quest]], mission 10. }}
name: Markwin

notes:

notes:
Hagor is an explorer and traveler. He wants to explore all of [[Tibia]] and discover its secrets. He calls himself "old hunter". Hagor knows much about the desert, and he mentions its name - the [[Jakundaf Desert]].
{{JSpoiler|To get to Hagor, go west from the [[Panpipe Quest]] and then south to a large room with 4 [[Fire Devil]]s. Then go down the hole to the east of the room and down another level. Here you'll find Hagor.
Hagor will give you [[Key 4022]] if you give him a [[Roll]]. {{Infobox Transcript| ''Player'': '''hi'''
Hagor: Greetings, adventurer Player. What leads you to me?
''Player'': '''Morrin'''
Hagor: Ah, I remember that man. We made a deal, guess about what.
''Player'': '''key'''
Hagor: Right! We can make the same deal if you give a fresh delicious roll. Do you have any?
''Player'': '''yes'''
Hagor: Oh, fine! Here you are. }} }}
name: Hagor
location: In the [[Jakundaf Desert]] dungeon, 3 levels down.

notes:
A Sweaty Cyclops is [[Ab'Dendriel]]'s armorer. He lives in a tower north-east of the depot. His parents lived there before [[elves]] settled down there. Among [[Cyclopes]] he is known as ''Bencthyclthrtrprr''. Humans call him ''Big Ben''. You can reach him through an underground cave and ask him to trade certain weapons; however, he will not accept these items saying that they are not what he is looking for. He is a smith, so he knows a lot about steel and its kinds: Mesh Kaha Rogh, Za'Kalortith, Uth'Byth, Uth'Morc, Uth'Amon, Uth'Lokr, Uth'Maer, Uth'Doon and Zatragil. You can have him forge certain rare metals from common items, but only by providing the appropriate language. Looks the same as a [[Cyclops]]. {{JSpoiler|To have him forge metals, you need to do [[The Sweaty Cyclops Quest]].
He is a part of the [[Koshei The Deathless Quest]], [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]] and the [[Obsidian Knife Quest]].}}
history: He was implemented with update {{Update|6.2}} Part of a [[Quest]] to obtain a [[Fire Sword]]. This quest was later removed. With update {{Update|7.8}} he now reduces items to their material form.
sounds: Hum hum, huhum.

Samir

notes: He is searching for riches on [[Treasure Island]].

notes:
Admires [[Ab'Dendriel]] very much.
Charles transports any [[premium]] players by ship to: {{Transport |Ankrahmun, 110 |Darashia, 180 |Edron, 150; shortcut cost: 90 |Liberty Bay, 50; shortcut cost: 20 |Oramond, 200;Rank of "Citizen" in the [[Rathleton Quest]] required.|Thais, 160; shortcut cost: 100 |Venore, 160 |Yalahar, 260; shortcut cost: 200}} Charles also offers shortcuts to a few destinations which are cheaper. However, you might get shipwrecked and end up in a different place when using them. These locations are: * An island west of the [[Meluna]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|125.24|126.205|7|2|1|0.50.5}}, as part of [[The Secret Library Quest]]. After using the ship's telescope (during night) and getting the [[Hawser (Item)]] from the heap of rubbish, use the hawser on the raft and you will get sent to [[Fibula]]. * A small island, part of the [[Ice Islands]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|125.113|123.254|7|2|1|0.50.5}}, where you can find [[Arctic Faun]]s. You can leave the island through the [[Ice Portal]], which brings you to [[Vega]], north of [[Carlin]], north of [[Thais]], [[Fibula]] or the south shore of [[Ragnir]]. * A small island north of Feyrist, {{Mapper Coords|text=here|130.182|125.159|7|2|1|0.50.5}}, where you can face [[Raxias]] when going in the teleporter. You get sent to [[Carlin]]'s temple after using the [[Energy Shrine]] there. * A small island in the middle of the three [[Laguna Islands]], {{Mapper Coords|text=here|126.200|128.170|7|4|1|0.250.25}}. You will find a dead human. Use it to gain a [[shovel]]. You can use that shovel on a [[hole]] next to it. Below, you find a small cave with a [[seashell]] and a dead explorer, in which you can find a [[Fishing Rod]]. There is some water inside the cave where you can fish in. You can leave this island by walking on the [[turtle]], which will bring you to [[Meriana]]. If you don't have access to [[Meriana]] yet, you will need to have a fish in your backpack for the turtle, which you can loot from the crab on the island or catch with the fishing rod and worms. Worms can be dug up from the sand by using the shovel. After shipwrecking on one of these locations, you cannot use the shortcut from Charles for 20 hours. He can also sail anyone to the [[Character World Transfer|world transfer]] island, [[Travora]].
sounds: Passages to Thais, Darashia, Edron, Venore, Ankrahmun, Liberty Bay, Oramond and Yalahar.
Ahoy. Where can I sail you today?
name: Charles
location: Western end of [[Port Hope]], on the boat.

notes:
'''The Gatekeeper was removed from Rookgaard in the [[Updates/8.2|Update 8.2]].'''
The Gatekeeper used to occupy the second floor of a small shrine-like building. This was then replaced by a wood shack. The shack moved and the area has been replaced with water after [[Updates/8.4|Update 8.4]], which in particular revamped the premium side of Rookgaard.
The Gatekeeper used to [[teleport]] premium characters from [[Rookgaard]] to the [[Mainland]]. There is also [[The Oracle]], on the free account side, who did the same. The difference between [[The Oracle]] and [[The Gatekeeper]] were your choices of what [[city]] to live in. The Gatekeeper could teleport you to [[Darashia]], [[Ankrahmun]], [[Port Hope]], [[Liberty Bay]], [[Ab'Dendriel]] or [[Kazordoon]].
Looked like an [[Angel Statue|angel statue]].

notes:
Recluse lizard living in the ruins of a long gone noble quarter. There is something strange about her.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Spirit Will Get You Quest]] and the [[Wayfarer Outfits Quest]].}}
name: Cranky Lizard Crone

notes: Faluae is the leader of The [[Deraisim]] caste. He can sell spells, but he'll only sell them for druids and paladins.
name: Faluae

notes: Kunibert helps newcomers find their way through [[Rathleton]] by marking important places such as the [[depot]] and the [[bank]] in the players' [[automap]] and escorting new players to the depot.
sounds: Hello, is this your first visit to Rathleton? I can show you around a little.
Talk to me if you need directions.
Need some help finding your way through Rathleton? Let me assist you.
I can inform you about the status of this world, if you're interested.
Free escort to the depot for newcomers!
name: Guide Kunibert

notes: Harog works at Beregar, he'll only sell you his Rust Removers after you complete [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].
name: Harog

notes:
Lives in a small room with a lot of [[Crystal]]s, [[Large Crystal]]s and [[Crystal Column]]s. If you greet him with '''hi''' he will answer:
Zirkon: SHHHHHHH, QUIET HERE! THIS IS THE SACRED PLACE OF THE DWARVEN GEOMANCERS!
name: Zirkon

notes: Zethra is a [[Equipment Shopkeeper NPCs|Equipment Shopkeeper]] who buys and mostly sells basic necessities. She calls herself '''Zethra the wormbane'''.
sounds: Come over here if you have to resupply!
name: Zethra
Captain Jack
location: On his boat, docked at the [[Isle of the Kings]]

name: Petros
location: The docks of [[Darashia]], on his boat

notes: {{JSpoiler|Involved in the [[Overhunting]] World Change.}}
sounds: <gulp gulp>
This will earn me some handsome amount of gold!
Muhahaha!
name: Cruleo

notes:
Dallheim protects the city from [[creatures]] with his [[Spikesword]]. If you become [[poisoned]], [[Burning|burned]] or [[electrified]] he can heal you and restore your [[hitpoints]] up to 65 by just saying "hi."
He also stops [[level]] 1 players from crossing the bridge.
sounds: The most dangerous monsters of Rookgaard are on the other side of this bridge.
Want to know what monsters are good for you at your level? Just ask me!
I'll crush all monsters who dare to attack our base.
Are you injured or poisoned? I can help you.
For Rookgaard! For Tibia!
name: Dallheim
location: The northern bridge out of [[Rookgaard]]'s city

notes: She has to take care of scores of babies and appears in the human realm during the [[Demon's Lullaby]] [[World Quest]] to seek some relief from this tiring occupation.
sounds: I want some days off.
Oh no. Not again!
Where is this brat again?
name: Demon Mother
location: In the middle of the [[Jakundaf Desert]]

notes: He gives new players information about [[Knight]]s and can make [[character]]s a Knight as long as they don't have a vocation.
sounds: Chaaarge! Ha!
Strength and courage!
Keep your armor shiny and your blade clean!
All young aspiring adventurers interested in knighthood come here!
name: Knight Hykrion
location: North-western building on the [[Island of Destiny]]

notes: She is Grimvale's [[Druid NPCs|druid]], and can also provide you with some handy [[equipment]].
sounds: Fangs, fur, hooves ... if it comes from a were-creature I'll buy it!
If you're in need of some tools, just ask me.
name: Gladys
location: Southeast on [[Grimvale]], in her little house.

sounds: Dummdee Dumm.
So much to do. So many ideas.
Urks! So old.
Now where did I put that uber-weapon again?
Hmmm pizza.
name: Knightmare (NPC)

notes: They assist [[Santa Claus]] in his mission to spread joy throughout the Tibian world and appear during [[Christmas]] time, between the [[Server Save]]s of December 12 and 31.
sounds: Fifty red-lacquered rocking horses... check!
Two hundred and fifty gallons of sherry to keep Santa warm during travel... check!
Three hundred Banor action figures... check!
Fourhundred  sugar canes, wrapped up and bundled... check!
Five thousand pieces of marzipan... <gulp>, erm, four thousand nine hundred ninety-nine pieces of marzipan - check...
name: Messenger of Santa
location: Near [[Santa Claus]] in every major town (between the [[Server Save]]s of December 12 and 31)

notes: Elvith is a typical [[Elves|elf]]. He loves to listen music and is very interested in it. He knows a lot about music and he sees music everywhere. He doesn't belong to any [[Elves|elvish caste]]. His name and profession are obviously an allusion to singer '''[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elvis_Presley Elvis Presley]'''.
name: Elvith

notes:
Maritima loves her fish friends, but is sad that the [[Quara]] treat them so badly.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Maritima

notes: Appears only during the [[Masquerade Days]]. His real name is Stanley Montgomery Edward Wilson Jaydon Alverton. He is a human just sitting in this giant costume pulling strings. He knows five hilarious jokes. He can't offer you his very special costume.
sounds: Your soul will be mine!
MUHAHAHAHAHA!
I SMELL FEEEEAR!
name: Stan
location: In [[Venore]], in [[Hugo]]'s shop, south-east from the [[depot]].

notes: Zerbrus protects the city from dangerous [[creatures]]. He will heal you if you are [[Poisoned]], [[Burning]] or [[Electrified]], and if you are heavily wounded he will heal you up to 65 [[health]].
sounds: Are you injured or poisoned? I can help you.
For Rookgaard! For Tibia!
No monster shall go past me.
The premium side of Rookgaard lies beyond.
Want to know what monsters are good for you at your level? Just ask me!
name: Zerbrus
location: The premium bridge out of [[Rookgaard]]'s city, [[premium]] side

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].}}
sounds: My pretty goods ... lost.
Hm ... who there?
Yip yip!
name: Sniff
location: Venore, ground floor in the Eastern city entrance tower.

notes:
Sven is the leader of the people in Svargrond. He is the current [[Jarl NPCs|Jarl]], which means that the barbarian clans of [[Svargrond]] have elected him. He is not too keen in welcoming strangers in the town, for this reason he might ask you to do a few tasks before you are accepted as a real barbarian amongst the others.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Barbarian Test Quest]].}}
sounds: Ha ha ha, it always amuses me to see those strangers passing out over our barbarian mead.
There is something in the air that worries me...
name: Sven
location: Western [[Svargrond]], in the tavern [[Tempest In A Meadhorn|Tempest in a meadhorn]]

notes: She can check if you fulfil all requirements to transfer to another [[world]]. If you do, she can teleport you to the departure platform, where your world transfer journey begins.
history: Before [[Travora]] island was swallowed by the sea with the [[Updates/10.90|Winter Update 2015]], Sharon was found at the north part of the island, on the ground floor.
sounds: Need help with the Character World Transfer? Come to me! I answer all of your questions.
name: Sharon

notes: He helps newcomers find their way through [[Port Hope]] by marking important places such as [[depot]] and [[bank]] in the players' automap. He can also escort you to the [[depot]].
sounds: Need some help finding your way through Port Hope? Let me assist you.
Ask me if you want to know something about the world status!
name: Guide Tiko
location: Western part of [[Port Hope]], near the boat.

name: Bron

notes: Players who have defeated [[Bakragore]] at least once can talk to this [[NPC]] to make a [[Crimson Offering]] and receive a [[Sanguine Set]] item.
name: Altar (NPC)

notes: '''Brom''' is the supervisor of the [[Duelling Arena]] in [[Kazordoon]].
sounds: Honour and glory!
Stand against your foes!
Let the stone drink blood!
name: Brom
location: The [[Kazordoon]] [[Duelling Arena]]; access via [[Mystic Flame]] by north gate in [[The Market]].

notes: Padreia is the grand [[druid]] of [[Carlin]]. Like most Carlin NPCs, she is female. She will teach [[druid]]s all of her knowledge about [[spell]]s. She is responsible not only for the guild but for the fields, and Carlin citizens health. She used to sell [[Fireball]] and [[Great Fireball]] before the [[Updates/8.1|winter update 2007]].
name: Padreia
Harlow
location: [[Yalahar]]: in the [[Trade Quarter]] docks (straight south from the main gate), West on [[Vengoth]] {{Mapper Coords|128.89|123.62|7|1|text=here}}.

notes: John the Carpenter can only be seen taking a bath during day. At night he's found as [[John (Bounac)|John]] in his house.
name: John the Carpenter

notes:
Chondur is the local voodoomaster, responsible for several enchantments regarding some of the inhabitants of [[Sabrehaven]]. He is like a father for them, and protects them from the evil magical influences of the [[Cultists]] that settled on the [[Shattered Isles]]. {{JSpoiler|Part of [[Shaman Outfits Quest]], [[The Shattered Isles Quest]] and the [[Blessed Stake Quest]].
He can supply you with the [[Stampor (Mount)|Stampor Mount]] if you bring him 30 [[Hollow Stampor Hoof]]s, 50 [[Stampor Horn]]s, and 100 [[Stampor Talons]].}}
sounds: Spirits of the ancestors, guide me.
name: Chondur

notes: He used to live in the dwarf camp nearby ({{Mapper Coords|128.166|127.133|7|4|text=here}}) before he was captured and imprisoned by the asuri.
sounds: Damn asuri!
Perfidious hags!
I shouldn't have left the camp!
name: Gilmak Copperbeard

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].}}
sounds: *yawn*
I just want to sleep.
Sooo tired.
name: Tired Tree

notes: When alive his name was [[Shearton Softbeard]] and he was unbeatable at kissing. He died when the [[Grothmok tunnels]] caved in. The tunnels were then sealed off to stop others from dieing as well.
name: A Dwarven Ghost

notes: Walter protects the city from [[creatures]].
name: Walter, The Guard

notes: Valentina is a mother, a grandmother and a housewife and also sells [[items]] for your beloved. She first appeared on [[Valentine's Day]] (February 14th) in 2008. She was also there on February 16th, 2010 to sell [[Heart Backpack]]s for the first time.
sounds: Flowers, cakes, presents and valentine cards - only today.
Show how much you care before it's too late.
name: Valentina

notes: Tells some nice stories.
name: A Ghostly Knight
location: Leverroom in the [[Pits of Inferno]] under the [[Plains of Havoc]].

notes: He sells most [[food]] except for [[meat]].
sounds: Fresh food! Finest quality!
name: Imalas
location: [[Carlin]] in the [[Central Plaza]], south of the [[Depot]]

notes:
It's actually a [[Gnome]] posing as a [[Dragon Lord]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Spike Tasks Quest]].}}
name: A Dragon Lord

notes: This [[NPC]] is an unreachable illusion. It is actually located two floors above ground level, and when you approach it, it disappears (similar to the mirage in the desert near [[Darashia]]).
name: A Tainted Soul

notes:
<noinclude>[[File:Pythius Treasure.png|thumb|Pythius and his treasure]]</noinclude>Pythius the Rotten is an undead dragon living in [[Beregar]] caves. He claims to have obtained his treasure from the civilization of [[Yalahar]] when their downfall began. You may challenge him as a part of [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]] if you have completed the [[The Queen of the Banshees Quest]] or at least received the kiss from the [[The Queen Of The Banshee|banshee queen]]. If you accept his challenge you can then access the teleporter next to him that leads to the dragon lord lair if you give him something for his treasure.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Hidden City of Beregar Quest]].}}
name: Pythius the Rotten

notes:
His real name is '''Tevon''', but he lost [[Desperate Soul|his soul]] and forgot about it.

{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Ferumbras' Ascendant Quest]].}}
Clyde runs the [[Port Hope Tavern]].
sounds: Sit down, have a drink and relax!
name: Clyde
location: North-western part of [[Port Hope]], leftmost of the depot, on the ground level of [[Port Hope Tavern]].

notes:
Say '''pass''' and the destination to go through his gate.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Hal
location: Between [[Arena and Zoo Quarter]] and [[Alchemist Quarter]]

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].}}
sounds: Ah, the pleasures to be an oracle!
Praised be Suon, the Benevolent Sun.
The steppe is dangerous these days.
name: Taya
location: Near the small temple of the Nykri Delta.

notes:
You can buy your furniture here when living on [[Cormaya]].
He may live in [[Cormaya House]].
sounds: Beds, chairs, tables, statues and everything you could imagine for decorating your home!
name: Yoem
location: North [[Cormaya]] in the courtyard on [[Cormaya Street]] and by [[Cormaya Flats]].

sounds: <clears throat> Get your armor and shields heeeeeeere! Upstairs!
Need some help? Just ask me, I can show you around!
Don't forget to protect yourself with a shield!
Selling the finest armors on Rookgaard!
Don't let these mean monsters hurt you - get better equipment now!
name: Dixi

notes: She is a blind scientist. {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Glooth Factory Quest]] - ''The Mutated Glooth Plague'' mission.}}
name: Georgia Rainbird

sounds: <sigh> lost... word...
<sigh> ohhhh.... memories...
The secrets... too many... sleep...
Loneliness...
name: Zarifan

notes: Duncan dislikes [[Liberty Bay]] and therefore lives in the rebel settlement of [[Sabrehaven]].{{JSpoiler|Part of [[Meriana Quest]].}}
name: Duncan

notes: Scott is the owner of a tavern in [[Senja]].
sounds: Hey there, adventurer! Need a little rest in my inn? Have some food!
name: Scott

notes:
Imbul transports anyone in Port Hope by ferry to the eastern end or the Centre of town for just 7 [[gp]].
{{seealso|Port Hope Ferries}}
name: Imbul
location: Western part of [[Port Hope]], on the surface level.

notes: {{JSpoiler|You need to talk to Tamoril in order to begin [[The First Dragon Quest]].}}
sounds: Come a little closer mortal.
FCHHHHH!
GRRRRRRR!
name: Tamoril

notes:
There are actually four dead bureaucrats, but they all have the same name. They are minions of [[Pumin]], one of the [[The Ruthless Seven]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the the [[Pits of Inferno Quest]].}}
sounds: Now where did I put that form?
Hail Pumin. Yes, hail.
name: A Dead Bureaucrat
location: In the [[Pits of Inferno]], in a long hall.

notes:
Ortheus is fond of [[Tea]]. Will you be the polite adventurer to bring him some?
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Blood Brothers Quest]].}}
name: Ortheus
location: [[Magician Quarter]], north-west section one floor up.

notes: The Destiny Seer can help you find your destiny if you're not sure what vocation you like best.
sounds: Feeling lost, child? Ask me, and I will guide you.
Let me help you find your destiny.
I can help you find your vocation.
name: The Destiny Seer
location: [[Island of Destiny]], inside the last tent

notes:
He looks like a [[Crustacea Gigantica]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]].}}
name: Guardian of the Deep Seas

notes:
He lives on a circular rock with in the middle an unreachable [[Fire Shrine]], all above [[Lava]]. If you greet him with '''hi''' he will answer:
Pyromental: Thissss issss the ssssacret place of the pyromanccccersssss. Leave!
name: Pyromental

notes: She sells many magical items along with her identical twin sister [[Turvy]], who deals in [[weapons]] and [[armor]].
sounds: Runes, wands, rods, health and mana potions! Have a look!
name: Topsy

notes:
Treat him with respect and say the correct regards to him, because if you say ''Hi'' instead of ''DJANNI'HAH'' he will put [[Soulfire]] on you, lasting for 150 turns of 10 [[hp]] each, for a total of 1500 damage. Before a certain update, he summoned several [[Green Djinn]] instead, even if the player was allied with the Efreet.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Djinn War - Efreet Faction]].}}
name: Baa'Leal

notes: Fiona buys magical ingredients for the Edron academy. She will also buy some items from demon bosses but she will only hint to buying it if you say it while having the item.
name: Fiona
location: [[Edron]] [[Ivory Towers]], in the southeastern tower, one floor up

notes:
He guards Thais against attacking [[creatures]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Inquisition Quest]], mission 1.}}
name: Kulag, The Guard

notes:
Only appears during August.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Hot Cuisine Quest]].}}
name: Jean Pierre

notes: Will buy some items for a good price.
sounds: Buying and selling all sorts of weapons and armors!
name: Hardek
location: Moving around south-west of [[Thais]], north of the entrance to [[Fibula]]. Sometimes it may be hard to find him; he can be on the east or west side of the river.

notes:
She says that she rarely has to use her authority, as life on [[Feyrist]] knows few troubles.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].}}
sounds: Annoying nightmarish creatures!
Our siblings are tainted. Bewail them!
This is the homestead of every pleasant dream.
name: Maelyrra

notes:
This NPC is the leader of the Married Men.
{{JSpoiler|This NPC is involved in the [[Rottin Wood and the Married Men Quest]].}}
<gallery mode="nolines">
File:Rottin_Wood's_House_(Floor_0).png|Floor 0
File:Rottin_Wood's_House_(Floor_1).png|Floor 1
File:Rottin_Wood's_House_(Floor_2).png|Floor 2
</gallery>
sounds: Ah, the great outdoors...
Mmmh, do you feel the thrill of the hunt, men?
Alright, seven pairs of antlers, twenty pelts, two... hey, guys where's the rest of the rabbit feet?! I hope you all know that this lucky charm business is just superstitious nonsense...
Be on your guard!
name: Rottin Wood

notes:
Shanar deals in [[Item#Armor Pieces|armor]] and [[Item#Weapons|weapons]]. 
He is a member of the kuridai caste. He also sells a few spells. Greet elves with 'Ashari' and say goodbye with 'Asha Thrazi'. It's a very good idea to gather loot at [[Elvenbane]] and then sell your loot here.
sounds: Fine elven armor and weapons. Have a look.
Looking for protective spells for druids? I can teach you.
name: Shanar
location: One floor underground northwest of [[Depot]] on [[Shadow Caves Street]].

notes: {{JSpoiler|She is part of the [[Top of the City Quest]].}}
name: Iriana
location: [[Trade Quarter]], near the gate to [[Factory Quarter]].

notes:
Will take you to the entrance to the underwater part of the [[Sunken Quarter]] known as the Monument Tower for 50 [[gp]] (round trip).
{{Transport|discount=no |Monument Tower, 50 |Sunken Quarter,0}}
name: Tarak

notes:
'''Ikassis''' is one of the [[Fae]] but took on the body of a [[Snake]]
 when she decided to participate in the expedition to the human realm as part of the Fae's mission to protect [[Feyrist]].{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].}}
sounds: Perhaps we shouldn't have come here.
I pity this poor mother.
The wildlife is troubled.
name: Ikassis

notes:
Ebenizer runs the bank in Edron. He exchanges [[Gold Coin]]s, [[Platinum Coin]]s and [[Crystal Coin]]s. You can deposit, withdraw, and transfer money as well as check your account balance.

His name is believed to be derived from the greedy character, "Ebenizer Scrooge," from the book "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Christmas_Carol A Christmas Carol]."
sounds: Don't forget to deposit your money here in the Tibian Bank before you head out for adventure.
name: Ebenizer
location: Above [[Edron]] [[Depot]], west part of the castle

notes: NPC added in the Winter Update 2010. He only appears during the [[World Quest]] [[A Piece of Cake]]. First sighted February 21, 2011. Ask him: "mass" and "base" to find out how much more of each is needed to complete the challenge.
sounds: I wonder if we will make it this year!
name: Billy The Baker
job: Member of the Magic Bakery Alliance

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Heart of Destruction Quest]].}}
name: Messenger of Heaven
location: North of [[Ankrahmun]] ({{Mapper Coords|129.147|127.121|7|2|text=here}}), West in [[Zao Steppe]] ({{Mapper Coords|129.12|122.142|7|2|text=here}}), South-West of [[Svargrond]] ({{Mapper Coords|125.166|122.62|6|2|text=here}}) and in the [[Otherworld]] ({{Mapper Coords|125.211|122.144|14|2|text=here}}).

notes: Willard deals in [[Item#Armor Pieces|armor]], [[Item#Weapons|weapons]] and [[ammunition]] and was once in the Thaian royal army.
name: Willard
location: East part of [[Edron]] castle, first floor

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Ice Islands Quest]].}}
sounds: If you're caught or killed, I'll deny that I have known you.
name: Nor
location: South in [[Krimhorn]], west of the [[Ice Witch]] tower

notes: Shanoya teaches players how to do distance fighting with [[Mean Paladin Spear]]s.
sounds: Want the best of all vocations? Become a paladin!
Master the bow to shoot an arrow in the knee!
Be a Jack of all trades, be a paladin!
Noble hunter, versatile adventurer - that's the paladin!
name: Shanoya
location: [[Island of Destiny]], inside the third tent

name: Barry

notes: He protects the city of Venore from attacking [[creature]]s from the swamp.
name: Warbert

notes: Salbra teaches players how to use the attack spell [[Exevo Dis Flam Hur]], the attack rune [[Lightest Magic Missile Rune]], and the healing spell [[Exura Dis]].
sounds: It's a kind of magic!
How to heal your party? I can teach you!
The fine arts of magic - rune and spellcraft!
Heal the world - make a better place!
Runes and spells - a beginner's guide!
name: Salbra
location: [[Island of Destiny]], inside the fourth tent

notes: Oressa is the priestess of [[Dawnport]]'s [[Temple]]. She can heal you up to 65 [[hp]] and can also remove any harmful [[Status Condition]]s. She is also the NPC you need to speak to to choose a [[Vocation]] and leave [[Dawnport]] after getting level 8.
sounds: Poisoned? Bleeding? Wounded? I can help!
Choose your vocation and explore the Mainland!
Undecided on your vocation? I can help you decide!
Come to me if you need healing!
name: Oressa

notes:
Hyacinth lives on a mountain northeast of the town of [[Rookgaard]]. He worships the god of nature, [[Crunor]]. He has fear about dark magic on the island, and what this could mean.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].}}
name: Hyacinth
location: [[Rookgaard]], atop the mountain to the northeast of the city

notes: He deals with magical items, like runes, potions, wands and rods.
sounds: Potions, wands and runes for aspiring magicians.
name: Tandros
location: Central part of northern [[Port Hope]], second floor above [[Port Hope Depot]].

notes: {{JSpoiler|Involved in the [[Twenty Miles Beneath the Sea Quest]] and the {{Spoiler Section|Glooth Factory Quest|The Gloud Ship}}.}}
name: Yeo
location: Entrance of [[Rathleton]], a little south of the [[Workshop Quarter]]

sounds: I don't like beer. Why didn't we ever create some alternative beverages?
If this place is too dark for you, your eyes are too weak.
We got to smoke them out, one way or another.
name: Dwarf Deep Guard

notes: He helps newcomers find their way through [[Ab'Dendriel]] by marking important places such as the [[Depot]] and the [[Bank]] in the players' [[Automap]] and escorting players to the [[depot]].
name: Guide Thelandil

notes:
Only appears during [[Christmas]] time, between the [[Server Save]]s of December 12 and 31. Rumours say that if you are nice to him, he will give you a present. The present you receive is random. You might receive:
{{Ilink|Candy Cane}}10 [[Candy Cane]]s +{{Ilink|Snowball}}10 [[Snowball]]s
{{Ilink|Candy Cane}}10 [[Candy Cane]]s +{{Ilink|Red Christmas Bundle}}{{Ilink|Blue Christmas Bundle}}{{Ilink|Green Christmas Bundle}}1 [[Christmas Bundle]]
{{Ilink|Candy Cane}}10 [[Candy Cane]]s +{{Ilink|Piggy Bank}}1 [[Piggy Bank]]
{{Ilink|Energy Ring}}1 [[Energy Ring]] +{{Ilink|Dwarven Ring}}1 [[Dwarven Ring]] +{{Ilink|Ring of Healing}}1 [[Ring of Healing]]
{{Ilink|Red Gem}}1 [[Red Gem]]
{{Ilink|Shiny Stone}}1 [[Shiny Stone]]
{{Ilink|Bullseye Potion}}1 [[Bullseye Potion]] +{{Ilink|Mastermind Potion}}1 [[Mastermind Potion]] +{{Ilink|Berserk Potion}}1 [[Berserk Potion]]
{{Ilink|Santa Doll}}1 [[Santa Doll]]
{{Ilink|Doll}}1 [[Doll]]?
{{Ilink|Violet Gem}}1 [[Violet Gem]] (semi-rare?)
{{Ilink|Dracoyle Statue}}1 [[Dracoyle Statue]]
{{Ilink|Stuffed Dragon}}1 [[Stuffed Dragon]]
{{Ilink|Moon Backpack}}1 [[Moon Backpack]] Presents which are '''only given to a few lucky players''':
{{Ilink|Panda Teddy}}1 [[Panda Teddy]]
{{Ilink|Teddy Bear}}1 [[Teddy Bear]]
{{Ilink|Santa Teddy}}1 [[Santa Teddy]]
{{Ilink|Amulet of Loss}}1 [[Amulet of Loss]]
{{Ilink|Bunnyslippers}} [[Bunnyslippers]]
{{Ilink|Dragon Claw}}1 [[Dragon Claw]]
{{Ilink|Ball Gown}}1 [[Ball Gown]]
{{Ilink|Gold Ingot}}1 [[Gold Ingot]]
{{Ilink|Snowman Doll}}1 [[Snowman Doll]]
{{Ilink|Bear Doll}}1 [[Bear Doll]]
{{Ilink|Soul Stone}}1 [[Soul Stone]] Also, if your server successfully finished the [[Lightbearer]] event and you helped by lighting all 10 fire basins, you may ask him for a '''very special present'''. You will then receive the [[Blazebringer]] mount.
In previous years Santa Clauses were controlled by [[CipSoft]] employees, and could hurt you if you were foulmouthed. At that time he also gave away a larger variety of items. Back then [[Knightmare]] organized races to find Santa Claus, giving a [[Teddy Bear]] to the winner. Nowadays he only gives extremely lucky persons on any server the precious [[Teddy Bear]].
During one year Santa gave better gifts in premium cities, but has since returned to his usual self, giving out random presents in every city. {{Seealso|Santa/Presents}}
name: Santa Claus
location:
Has a [[Santa's House|house]] on the [[Ice Island]] of [[Vega]]. Between the [[Server Save]]s of December 12 and 31, he can be found in or near each major town, usually near the [[Depot]]. '''[[Ab'Dendriel]]''': Underground shops, near [[Shanar]]. {{Mapper Coords|text=here|127.144|123.173|8|4|1|0.250.25}}
'''[[Ankrahmun]]''': In the [[Tavern]] west from boat. {{Mapper Coords|text=here|129.44|128.114|6|4|1|0.250.25}}
'''[[Carlin]]''': At the [[White Wave Cellar]], south-west of town. {{Mapper Coords|text=here|126.59|124.95|8|8|1|0.1250.125}}

notes:
She or he only appears on test servers. The Testserver Assistant will give '''blessings''' if you ask and when saying '''money''' or '''gold''' she will hand out 10 [[File:Crystal Coin.gif]] [[Crystal Coin]]s. You can ask for money for infinite times. The idea behind free money is creating no limits in buying supplies and travelling, which makes it easier to test a lot of things in short time. 

You can also ask for '''experience''' to receive level up your character. On the most tests the NPC gave 50,000,000 each time, and you can ask as many times as you need until you are above level 350 (which means you can get up to level 357 depending on the level you start from). 

Saying '''trade''' will also give you the option to open different trade dialogs for items relevant to the current test, general equipment and other special items.
history: On the [[Test Server]] for the [[Winter Update 2019]], the Testserver Assistants were updated. Among other things, they now have different outfits that match the city they are in. For example, in [[Svargrond]] the Assistant wears the [[Norseman Outfits]].
sounds: Free stuff! Check it out!
name: Testserver Assistant

notes:
He is [[Santa Claus]]'s assistant. If you say '''Santa Claus''', he has a very interesting story for you.
{{JSpoiler| ''Ruprecht: Well, he does not really like it if someone tells his story ... but I do! A long, long time ago Santa was nothing but a greedy little dwarf. A real miser, I tell ya ...'' ''He was greedy even by dwarven standards. He would never share anything or give away the cheapest thing in his possession ...'' ''One day a woman came to his house and asked him for a cup of water ...'' ''Of course he refused. He even mocked her for being so naive. But what he did not know was that this woman was some kind of mighty faery or perhaps a goddess in disguise ...'' ''Be it as it may, the woman cursed old Santa, forcing him to share his fortune with everyone he met ...'' ''Santa was horrified. Of course, he could not bear the thought of sharing anything at all. So he went into hiding ...'' ''He hid in the most remote places in the world, but time and again someone found him out, and the curse made him share his wealth ...'' ''And know something? Old Santa actually came to like it! He saw the joy his presents brought, and this opened his old stony heart ...'' ''And he learned that this way his fortune gave him more joy and pleasure than it ever did when he locked it away. ...'' ''Over the years he turned it into a game. He hid somewhere to reward those who found him ...'' ''But once every year, on a very special day which happens to be his curse's anniversary, he goes out and brings presents to the people, and especially to the children ...'' ''Well, that is his story ... Nah, that's not a tear in my eye. It's just the wind, you know.'' }}
name: Ruprecht
location: [[Vega]], he has his own hut next to Santa's house.

notes:
'''Cledwyn O'Reilly''' is a smith by trade, but has a passion for collecting precious stones and metals. He will exchange various armors providing a skill and resistance bonus for 100 [[Silver Token]]s each, and the same price applies to both addons of the [[Rift Warrior Outfits]].
He will also enchant (recharge) certain items for 2 [[Silver Token]]s: *{{Ilink|Pendulet}} [[Pendulet]], *{{Ilink|Sleep Shawl}} [[Sleep Shawl]], *{{Ilink|Blister Ring}} [[Blister Ring]], *{{Ilink|Amulet of Theurgy}} [[Amulet of Theurgy]], *{{Ilink|Ring of Souls (Depleted)}} [[Ring of Souls (Depleted)]], *{{Ilink|Turtle Amulet}} [[Turtle Amulet]]. Rings from the [[Primal Set]] can be recharged for 5 [[Silver Token]]s: *{{Ilink|Spiritthorn Ring}} [[Spiritthorn Ring]], *{{Ilink|Alicorn Ring}} [[Alicorn Ring]], *{{Ilink|Arcanomancer Sigil}} [[Arcanomancer Sigil]], *{{Ilink|Arboreal Ring}} [[Arboreal Ring]]. Cledwyn is the cousin of [[Yana]]. Unlike him, she collects [[Gold Token]]s.
sounds: Trading tokens! First-class bargains!

His neighbor in Thais is [[Frodo]], innkeeper of the Frodo's Hut, which is clearly an [[Allusions#Samwise Gamgee|allusion]] to the J.R.R. Tolkien's novel [[wikipedia:The Lord of the Rings|The Lord of The Rings]] where [[Frodo]] and Sam are the main plot characters. He was the first NPC to see the Tibian light of day.

notes:
Chester is Captain of the [[TBI]] ('''T'''ibian '''B'''ureau of '''I'''nvestigation). His direct superior is [[King Tibianus]]. He has control over the '[[Red Legion|Red Guard]]' but prefers to work alone. He left the public scene after his failure to defend the colony [[Carlin]] against the [[Orcs]].
Chester is very suspicious, almost paranoid. He holds detailed information on almost every [[Thais NPCs|Thaian citizen]].
If you say ''heal'' to him he will take a [[Life Ring]] from your [[inventory]] and then heal you up to 1000 [[hp]] (if you have more than 1000 hp you won't be healed, instead he will reduce your hitpoints to 1000). {{JSpoiler|He is part of the [[Secret Service Quest]] and he [[Exchange Quests|exchange]]s [[Life Crystal]]s for [[Life Ring]]s.
To trade a [[Life Crystal]] for a [[Life Ring]], follow these transcripts:
{{Infobox_Transcript| Player: '''hi'''
Chester Kahs: Salutations, stranger.
Player: '''Gamel rebel'''
Chester Kahs: Are you saying that Gamel is a member of the rebellion?
Player: '''yes'''
Chester Kahs: Do you know what his plans are about?
Player: '''magic crystal Lugri deathcurse'''
Chester Kahs: That is terrible! Will you give me the crystal?
Player: '''yes'''
Chester Kahs: Thank you! Take this ring. If you ever need some healing, come here, bring me the ring and ask me to 'heal' you.
Player: '''bye'''

notes:
Nemal is blind. That's why he can't read or write. He calls himself "wanderer". His father knew [[Gharonk]], a very strange language. He will reward you if you help him with a problem. {{JSpoiler|To get to this [[NPC]], go down in the ruin in the [[Jakundaf Desert]] and go down 5 levels. Walk north and turn to walk south around a corner, watch out for 1-3 [[Bonelord]]s in the clearing to the left. Take the ladder up from this cave, then go north past an intersection until you arrive at a locked door. Find a nearby ladder and climb it. There you will find Nemal.

Since Nemal is blind, you can help him see by curing his blindness. The [[Potion of Regained Vision (Book)|book]] containing the recipe for the potion of regained vision is in one of the bookcases in the [[Desert Dungeon Library]]. Bring Nemal all listed ingredients to obtain [[Key 4037]]. {{Infobox Transcript| ''Player'': '''hi'''
Nemal: Hello. How are you? Maybe you can help me: Do my shoes have the same colour?
''Player'': '''blind'''
Nemal: Yes, I seem to be blind. But I am not sure - maybe the dungeons are too dark!
''Player'': '''potion of regained vision'''
Nemal: I heard of a potion of regained vision ... but I can't remember how to make it! Maybe you can help me. Do you know something about it?
''Player'': '''yes'''
Nemal: So, did you bring the ingredients with you, stranger?
''Player'': '''yes'''
Nemal: You seem to have them with you. Can you tell me, how many minutes I have to cook them?
''Player'': '''31'''
Nemal: Ah. It seems to work. But what are the words I have to speak?
''Player'': '''nalus murtu'''
Nemal: Thank you! NALUS MURTUUU! ... I can see again! To show you, how grateful I am, I'll give you a key. Be wise when using it. I can't tell you, where it matches, but ... take good care, it is useless without mental powers!}} }}
name: Nemal

[[Karl]] in Carlin secret tavern in response to the keyword "Todd" says that he is "a true fighter for manhood", also [[Shauna]] says that she scared him so much that he left the town in the night - seems like an undiscovered or unfinished quest.

There is some unexplained lore connected to this NPC. Near the entrance of the Adventurerer's Guild, there is a statue of Fasul Abrek, "founder of the adventurer's guild, fallen hero, slayer of kings, met his end at the hands of [[Elane (Character)|Elane]]". Rotem Valos is the only NPC on the island who seems to know something about Fasul, but is unwilling to talk about him... yet. Additionally, the name "Rotem Valos" is an anagram for "almost over".

Rotem Valos is mentioned in [[Desert Storm (Book)]] and is the author of [[New Hero (Book)|New Hero]].

notes:
He hangs around the [[tavern]] and offers a game of dice.
You can bet from 1 to 99 [[gold]] and if the dice lands on 6 you get 5 times your bet. You may also bet 100 gp for a chance to win a [[die]]. Similar to the main money gambling game, if the dice lands on 6 you win the dice.
If you want to play with him, you must say: "dice" - "money" - "(any number from 1 to 100)".
There were rumors that you can increase your chance to win a bet with him if you wear a [[Wolf Tooth Chain]], but it was proven false. The chance to win is 1/6, so you will lose money in the long run because you will only win 5 times your original bet on a successful roll (unless you play for dice and can sell it for more than 600 gp).
He has a cousin named [[Hugo]]. {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].}}

name: A Bearded Woman

notes:
Briasol runs a jewelry store in Ab'Dendriel. In the past, Briasol ran the bank, but this job has been passed on to [[Finarfin]] at the Ab'Dendriel [[depot]]. If you are new to Ab'Dendriel there is a staircase that leads down to the underground shops. The location of the stairs is slightly northwest of the the depot and is marked by four stones arranged in a square.
{{JSpoiler|Also sells a [[Fine Vase]] for 1000 [[gp]] in the [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].}}
sounds: Come and take a look at the finest gems in the lands of Tibia.
name: Briasol
location: One floor underground on [[Shadow Caves Street]]

sounds: Passages to Thais, Carlin, Ab'Dendriel, Port Hope, Edron, Darashia, Liberty Bay, Svargrond, Gray Island, Yalahar and Ankrahmun.
name: Captain Fearless
location: On his ship located at the [[Venore Harbor|harbor]] in northern [[Venore]] on [[Walk of Flame]].

notes:
She's the last one to stand sentry near the [[Desecrated Glade]]. She says her name is only known to the wind.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Forgotten Knowledge Quest]].}}
sounds: Life is fading from the glade.
The trees whisper with fear.
We have to bring life back into the glade!
name: Weakened Forest Fury

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Spike Tasks Quest]].}}
name: Gnombold

notes: Eliza only sells party buff spells. She will also tell you what the exact [[Time|Tibian time]] is (in AM/PM) if you say "time" to her.
sounds: If you always hunt on your own, you won't need my spells.
If you care for your party, I can teach you.
name: Eliza

notes: '''Faloriel''' originally hails from [[Ab'Dendriel]], but has been living in [[Issavi]] for a long time now. He sells [[Potions]]; [[Khanna]] to his northeast sells [[Runes]] and [[Wands and Rods]].
sounds: Health potions! Mana potions! Buy them here!
All kinds of potions available here!
name: Faloriel

notes:
Buys and sells [[Weapons]] to adventurers. His granddaughter [[Dixi]] works upstairs buying and selling [[Armor]] and [[Shields]].
On top of the [[Wasp Tower]] there is an advertising sign: :{{Message|type=look|You read: Feeling ill?
Are you poisoned?
This does not have to happen to you again!
Buy quality armor at Obi's!}}
sounds: Only quality steel and wood used for my weapons!
Buy your weapons here!
Selling and buying all sorts of weapons, come and have a look!
Give those monsters a good whipping with my weapons!
name: Obi

notes:
She is a member of the [[Midnight Flame]] and claims she can foresee the future. Unlike her fellow clan members, Narsai is actually blind and doesn't need to pretend by wearing a blindfold.
The book [[The Medusa and the Blind Maiden (Book)]] is about her relationship with [[Alyxo]].
sounds: I can't bring down a crocodile myself.
Alyxo has the most beautiful voice, that's for sure.
I don't want to disappoint Kallimae.
name: Narsai

notes: Percy Silverhand is the governor of [[Liberty Bay]], and is the representative of the [[King Tibianus|King of Thais]] for that area. He has a daughter named [[Eleonore|Eleonore Silverhand]].
name: Percy Silverhand

notes: You can only reach Eremo by asking [[Pemaret]] in [[Cormaya]] for a passage to [[Eremo's Island]].
name: Eremo
location: [[Eremo's Island]], a small island between [[Edron]] and [[Cormaya]].

notes: She admitted herself to being the protector of [[Grimvale]]. Normally, she is on the ground floor of her house. However, when it's full moon on Grimvale she will barricade herself upstairs. {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Grimvale Quest]].}}
sounds: Not enough purple nightshade ... not enough liquid silver. *sigh*
You think the full moon is a romantic affair? Think again!
This place isn't safe. You should leave this island.
name: Maeryn
location: South-west on [[Grimvale]], in a small house.

notes: He can tell you about [[The Colours of Magic]] event and about his favourite wizard Fern of Nature.
sounds: Green is the colour of life.
Preserving nature in its purest form.
Leaves, bushes, meadows... green is my colour!
name: Nathaniel

notes: Tells some nice stories.
name: A Ghostly Guardian
location: In the [[Dream Realm]] under the [[Plains of Havoc]].

notes: He is loyal to the pact that the early residents of [[Ankrahmun]] made with the spirits and can tell you a lot about the reign of one of the first pharaohs, [[Horestis]], which confirms the [[Tibian Explorer Society]]'s suspicion of a relation of the [[Lizards]] to the founders of [[Ankrahmun]].
name: An Ancient Priest

notes: She was sent to [[Port Hope]] by the academy of [[Edron]] to function as an adviser in magical matters and as a teacher for sorcerers in need of training.
name: Myra
location: North-western part of [[Port Hope]], leftmost of the depot, on the first floor of [[Port Hope Tavern]].

name: Chuckles
location: [[Inner City]] in [[Yalahar]] second floor in the tower north of the depot.

notes: There exist four of them.{{JSpoiler|Informs you about the [[Overhunting]] World Change.}}
name: Huntsman

notes:
[[Parrot]]s can repeat phrases said by humans.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Treasure Hunt Quest]].}}
sounds: No talk to Shkiiiiiiip! CAAAW!
Meee! Here! Talk talk!
ONE, TWO, SHREEEEEE!
Shkip ish shtuuupid!!
Talk to meeeee! CAAAW!
name: Polly

notes:
Chemar Ibn Kalith is a licensed carpetpilot and responsible for the [[Darashia]]n airmail. He will only sell flying carpets to those who have mastered the art of flying.
''Note: [[Letter]]s cost only 5 [[gp]], [[Parcel]]s only 10 [[gp]], and travelling is 10 [[gp]]s cheaper if you have completed the [[Postman Quest]].''
sounds: Ask me if you need letters or parcels. I'll deliver them via airmail, of course!
Feel the wind in your hair during one of my carpet rides!
name: Chemar

notes:
Loria is well acquainted with magic. She knows much about [[spells]] and will tell you about them if you ask.
Loria is a former apprentice of [[Alatar]], the Sage. The lake is named like her master, [[Alatar]], the Sage.
Loria was once part of a quest to learn the ultimate explosion spell before [[Edron]] was created. If you say quest she will say the following "I heard from a mystic bone of the lich lord below the House of Necromant. Bring it to me, and you will receive a reward.
name: Loria

notes:
After convincing him he will bring you to:
{{Transport
 |Ab'Dendriel, 160
 |Ankrahmun, 230
 |Carlin, 185
 |Darashia, 210
 |Liberty Bay, 275
 |Port Hope, 260
 |Thais, 200
 |Venore, 185
}}
{{JSpoiler|To be able to travel do the ''Searoutes around Yalahar'' of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
Strangely, unlike most other elven [[NPC]]s in-game Karith does not respond when greeted or said good bye too in elven (with Ashari and Asha Thrazi respectfully). It can be assumed by his presence as the only elf in Yalahar that he was raised there and never learned to speak his own people's language.
name: Karith
location: In the harbour of [[Yalahar]], in a ship one floor up.

notes:
There are two [[NPCs]] called Edron Guardsman. They guard the entrances of [[Edron]]. They don't really talk to you, they just say ''Move on!'' if you try to talk to them.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[What a Foolish Quest]].}}
name: Edron Guardsman

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].}}
sounds: I will annoy him, too. He he!
Annoying merchant!
name: Ra'Clette
location: Venore, in the south production site.

notes: Borkas Flersson works at the [[Plank and Treasurechest Market]].
sounds: Get your furniture here. Or don't. Whatever.
name: Borkas

notes: Warns you of the [[Lizard Chosen]] threat below. He claims to be the leader of a clan, the [[Grey Shadow Clan]], who explore uncharted areas of [[Zao]].
name: Nina

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Primal Ordeal Quest]].}}
sounds: Oh my!
Only gnomish genius can prevent the end of the world now.
Our time is running out.
name: Gnomish Operative (Volcano)
location: [[Gnomprona]] at the heart of the Volcano.

notes:
'''Muriel''' is the sorcerer guild leader in Thais. He used to sell [[Fireball]] before the [[Updates/8.1|winter update 2007]], after that update [[Fireball]] became a premium spell. You can buy a [[spellbook]] from him for 150gps by mentioning "spellbook".

Muriel wrote the following books: * [[Famous Necromancers (Book)|Famous Necromancers]] * [[Famous Necromants (Book)|Famous Necromants]] * [[How to Create Spellbooks (Book)|How to Create Spellbooks]] * [[How to Manipulate Runes (Book)|How to Manipulate Runes]] * [[The Secrets of Rune Magic (Book)|The Secrets of Rune Magic]] * [[What Runes Are Made Of (Book)|What Runes Are Made Of]] He is mentioned in a [[Porgol's Strange Behaviour (Book)|letter]] that was supposed to be sent to him, but the sender died in the [[Plains of Havoc]]. {{JSpoiler| He is part of [[Into The Bone Pit Quest]] }}
sounds: Did you hear about the missing member of the Explorer Society?
There are rumours about a mysterious inscription underneath Thais.
The wisdom of spellcasting is the source of power.
name: Muriel

notes: This [[NPC]] is an unreachable illusion. It is actually located two levels above ground level, and when you approach it, it disappears (similar to the mirage in the desert near [[Darashia]]).
name: An Apparition

notes: Bonifacious deals in [[Food]]s.
name: Bonifacius
location: [[Edron]], located in the small shop to the west of the bank in the castle, north of the Depot entrance.

notes: Her name is Madame Fayla Thibault. She gives music lessons, but is fully booked at the moment.
sounds: Do, re, mi, fa, so la, ti, do! <hums>
name: Fayla
location: Madame Feyla's Music Chamber, in the east of [[Upper Rathleton]].

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].}}
sounds: I have to ... No, I don't dare ...
This is a very strange part of the world.
The children are waiting for their presents.
name: Tooth Fairy

notes:
'''Donald McRonald''' is a farmer in [[Thais]]. He runs the farm together with his wife [[Sherry McRonald]].
His name is partly taken from the farmer named '''MacDonald''' in the nursery rhyme [[wikipedia:Old MacDonald Had a Farm|Old MacDonald Had a Farm]], and partly from '''Ronald McDonald''', mascot of the large fast-food chain [[wikipedia:McDonalds|McDonalds]].
name: Donald McRonald
Grombur
location: [[Beregar Mines]], south of the mines entrance.

notes:
Tokel is a farmer, and proud of it.
<gallery mode="nolines">
Tokel's house.png|Tokel's house
</gallery>
sounds: Are you hungry? I offer bread, cheese, ham and meat. Perfect for a little snack.
name: Tokel

notes: You can only reach this NPC when reaching the last stage of [[Farmine]] by doing [[The New Frontier Quest]].
name: Melian

notes: He will sail you back to the harbour you came from. If you already bought a ticket that day it will be for free. If you haven't yet, it will cost you 1,000 [[gp]].
history: Before [[Travora]] island was swallowed by the sea with the [[Updates/10.90|Winter Update 2015]], Captain Tiberius was found one floor lower than his current location, {{Mapper Coords|125.57|126.112|6|2|text=here}}.
sounds: Changed your mind? Travel back to the continent with me.
name: Captain Tiberius

notes:
He's a [[Hunter NPCs|hunter]], but as of late spends most of his time researching the 'Curse of the Full Moon'.
When it's full moon on [[Grimvale]], he'll become a [[Owin (Creature)|lycanthrope]] which can be fought in the caves below.
sounds: I hope their next raid will be less violent.
The inquiries were dangerous, but I hope the benefit will be worth the risks.
My notes are almost complete.
name: Owin

notes:
Ottokar is fighting swamp fever. But as he can't leave his patients, he is in need of help. You can give him a donation of money.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Swamp Fever]] [[World Change]].}}
sounds: Where to get enough food for all?
Oh my! Oh my!!
This time things are getting troublesome
All these troubles.
name: Ottokar

notes:
He protects the city of Venore from assaulting [[creature]]s from the swamp.
If you call him a bad name he shoots you with fire that does 10 damage every second for 10 seconds.
name: Christoph

notes:
He is working in the swamp and needs supplies to continue.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Venore Daily Tasks Quest]].}}
sounds: Blast it! Where are those lazy boys when you need them.  Always late!
You there! Don't dilly-dally! Cut those weeds down and give me some room here!
You! Yes, you! Come here! We need a machete to clear those swamp thickets!
Darn it! Why did that stupid boy George lose the reserve grind stones in the swamp. We'll never make good way this way!
You there, Mr-I-lost-my-knife-in-the-swamp! Make yourself useful, will you? Go see Norman and get a job!
name: Scott The Scout

notes:
His full name is Dronk Coaljuggler, [[son of Fire]], from the [[Savage Axes]]. Dronk needs to drain the water and find his friend, [[Groam]], but the water pump needs [[Coal]] to work.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Awash]] [[World Change]].}}
sounds: Bah! Sludge everywhere.
Groam... is that you?
Ack... my clothes are all soaked.
Even the air down here is all damp...
name: Dronk

notes:
Implemented in the first half of the [[Summer Update 2013]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Hunting for Tokens Quest]]. After starting his quest, you can trade with him.}}
sounds: Oh you're not the most communicative kind, are you?
name: Jorge

notes:
As every guard, he protects the city of Venore from attacking [[creature]]s from the swamp. He serves in garrison. He knows a lot about Venore, swamp and swampmonsters - especially amazons, swampelves and swamptrolls.
And the most improtant thing! "Do not try to say any dirty word to him! Or he attacks and burns you!".
name: Jean Claude
location: North-east of [[Venore]], in front of the second [[depot]].

notes: This [[NPC]] is an unreachable illusion. It is actually located two floors above ground level, and when you approach it, it disappears (similar to the mirage in the desert near [[Darashia]]).
name: A Tortured Soul

notes: '''Nibble''' is the leader of the [[Krailos]] [[Goblins]], but he has been captured by the [[Ogres]] to be their slave and cannot do much to help his kin. His real name is ''Golozo Taku Narkat Kash Bartak Har-Alhad''.{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].}}
sounds: Work, work, work... <sigh>
Making grub as fast as can!
Poor goblin! Poor goblin!
<sigh>
name: Nibble

notes: By giving him a [[White Mushroom]] (just say '''hi'''), you will receive a [[Dragonfetish]]. This can be sacrificed in the dragon room below [[Draconia]] to [[teleport]] back to [[Ab'Dendriel]]. If you don't have a White Mushroom with you or have already received a Dragonfetish you haven't used yet, he won't speak to you.
sounds: AHHHH THE PAIN OF AGESSS! THE PAIN!
name: An Old Dragonlord

notes: {{JSpoiler|He is the main NPC of the [[Feaster of Souls Quest]].}}
name: Para Norbert
Alesar

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].}}
name: Captain Jack Rat

notes: He is a direct descendant of [[Kesar Etzel]], the founder of the [[Order of the Lion]]. The siblings of his antecedent, [[Grand Master Oberon|Oberon]] and [[Scarlett Etzel]], founded the [[Order of the Falcon]] and the [[Order of the Cobra]], respectively.
name: Kesar the Younger
location:
[[Bounac]]'s throne room, during day.
In the quarters one floor down, during night.

notes:
Ashari is the First Voice of the [[Repenter]]s. He does not speak the [[Elven Language]]. Ironically, he notices the player's reaction when asked about his name, as his name actually means "Hello" in the Elven Language.
{{JSpoiler|Talk to him in order to get and report tasks of [[The Repenters Quest]].}}
name: Ashari

notes:
[[Gabel]]'s second in command, described as eccentric but wise. A respected fighter and general of the Marid. [[Djema]] refers to him as Uncle Fad.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Djinn War - Marid Faction]].}}
name: Fa'Hradin

notes: NPC Santiago, full name '''Santiago Fuentes''', is the first NPC a new tibian meets. He offers new tibians a chance to earn their first pieces of equipment, by exploring the basic elements of the game; using items, using equipment, fighting, looting creatures and regaining health.
sounds: Evil little beasts... I hope someone helps me fight them.
Nasty creepy crawlies!
Don't be shy, can't hurt to greet me with 'hello' or 'hi'!
Hey! You over there, could you help me with a little quest? Just say 'hi' or 'hello' to talk to me!
name: Santiago

notes: Buys and sells weapons.
sounds: Selling and buying fine weapons!
name: Rowenna

notes: Teaches spells to [[paladin]]s
sounds: Isn't the paladin class the mightiest of them all? I guess they are probably the most graceful at least.
name: Helor
location: North-western part of [[Port Hope]], leftmost of the depot, on the first floor of [[Port Hope Tavern]].

notes: '''Saros''' is a member of the [[Sapphire Blade]], their duty being to ensure [[Issavi]]'s safety.
name: Guard Saros

notes:
'''Alkestios''' is one of the [[Fae]] but took on the body of a [[White Deer]]
 when he needed to lead the expedition to the human realm as part of the Fae's mission to protect [[Feyrist]].{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Threatened Dreams Quest]].}}
sounds: Even the trees are sensing a greater evil.
The wildlife is troubled.
There are many hidden dangers lately.
name: Alkestios

notes:
{{Transport |Liberty Bay, 400 |discount=no}}

He says a funny sentence when asked about [[Yalahar]]: "Captain Cookie: ''I travelled here, hoping to find the [[Wikipedia:Cockaigne|cockaigne]]. Imagine my disappointment when I discovered I was wrong.''"
name: Captain Cookie
location: [[Yalahar]], on the ship left of [[Karith]]'s ship.

notes: Robin is the Chief Huntsman of [[King Tibianus III]], as he was for the former king. He is already an old man and doesn't have many friends alive.
name: Robin
location: [[Thais]], north from the [[Sorcerer]] guild on [[Sorcerer's Avenue]].

notes: Janz sells [[furniture]], wall hangings, decorations, and more. Everything you might need to furnish your home.
sounds: Moved into a new house? I got the perfect furniture for you.
name: Janz

sounds: The life of a dwarf is an eternal struggle. It hardens us and makes us the fine race we are, jawoll.
name: Isimov

notes: Asrak the Ironhoof is the overseer of the Fighting Pits and the trainer of gladiators. He knows a lot about [[Mooh'Tah]] - a way to achieve perfection as warrior. Asrak teaches [[spell]]s to Knights and Paladins.
sounds: Mooh! Tah!
name: Asrak

notes:
Yawno is very tired because all he does is fish for [[Shimmer Swimmer]]s.
{{JSpoiler|Yawno can inform you about the [[Twisted Waters World Change]].}}
sounds: One of them... I just saw... *yawn* one of them...
Mmhnmnmnmmmh... no, nooo...! Lemme sleep... I don't wanna go to school...
It... *yawn* will show up... sooner or later... *yaaawn*
name: Yawno

notes:
He is a member of the [[Inquisition]] and commander of the [[Roshamuul]] mission.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Roshamuul Quest]] & the [[Adventures of Galthen Quest]], Galthen and the City of Gold mission.}}
name: Sandomo

notes:
A being thought long dead.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[First Dragon Quest]].}}
name: The First Dragon (NPC)
location: In the [[First Dragon Lair]], deep below [[Nostalgia]].

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]].}}
name: Gnomelvis

notes: Can only trade after completing [[The Order of the Lion Quest]]. Can only sell "Ethereal" items after completing the [[Dreamer's Challenge Quest]]. Can only sell "Gnomish" items after killing 20 bosses in [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]].
name: Augustin

notes: You can buy your ammunition here.
sounds: Everything a paladin needs! Come visit my shop!
name: Perac
location: Near west gate of [[Carlin]] on [[Theater Avenue]]

notes: Rose works at [[Crunor's Finest Warehouse]]. To buy hydra tongue you must say '''hydra tongue'''; you can't buy it via the trade window.
sounds: Have a look at my beautiful flowers!
name: Rose
location: [[Venore]], between the [[temple]] and second [[depot]], near the [[boat]].

sounds: Passage to Cormaya! Unforgettable steamboat ride!
name: Brodrosch

notes:
Trimegis is the king's newest court mage and adviser in arcane matters (the last court mage was killed by [[Ferumbras]] in one of his attacks).
He can tell you something of the history of Thais and about other [[Thais NPCs|people]] around town.
name: Trimegis
location: [[Rain Castle]], central tower, in north-west [[Thais]] on [[Royal Avenue]] (go up the stairs to the left in the throne room).

notes:
Her full name is Duria Steelbender, [[daughter of Fire]], from the [[Dragoneaters]].
She is the [[Knight Guild Leader NPCs|Knight Guild Leader]] of [[Kazordoon]].
name: Duria

notes:
Captain Kurt will transport you to an accessible port after they have ventured themselves through the [[Island of Destiny]]. He can also provide you with information regarding the accessible towns. WARNING: Do not attempt to take more than 2000 [[gold]] with you. He will not allow you to leave the Island of Destiny with more than 1000 gold on your character. So deposit 1000 gp in your [[bank account]] (this can be done at the nearby [[Raffael]]) and take the rest with you.
|
sounds: Harr! Wanna go off this island? Need me an' my ship!
name: Captain Kurt
location: Northern [[Island of Destiny]], on his boat

notes:
Nurik is a trader, his lifelong dream is to buy the [[Dwarven Bridge]].
{{JSpoiler|You will meet Nurik during [[The Thieves Guild Quest]].}}
name: Nurik

notes: He supplies his part of the city with meat. He is the cheapest [[Ham]] seller in game.
name: Soilance

notes: Bruno is married to [[Marlene]], and thinks she talks too much. He thinks highly of [[Graubart]].
name: Bruno

notes:
He is a breeder. He's very skilled at a special type of magic that alters animals' appearance and behaviour.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Tamerin
location: [[Arena and Zoo Quarter]] ([[Yalahar]]). Just in front of the unreachable [[Nightmare Scion]] there is a stairway going down, leading to a a small basement.

name: Gabel

notes:
The prisoner is also known as the '''Mad Mage'''. Before becoming a prisoner he lived elsewhere in the cave system in the so-called [[Mad Mage Room]].
He was locked up in a tower in the [[Mintwallin]] prison because [[Markwin]] could not understand him. There is a note about him writen by Markwin in [[Chronicle of Mintwallin IV (Book)|one of his books]]. You will need [[Key 3620]] to open the door to the prison he is held in.
Say ''sell rune'' to him and he will offer you 50,000 gps for any blank rune you might have on you. However, he will only pay you 10 gps once you go through with the trade.{{JSpoiler|Main [[NPC]] of the [[Mad Mage Room Quest]] and part of [[The Paradox Tower Quest]].}}
name: A Prisoner

notes: His full name is Ferus Gemcutter, [[son of Fire]] and [[Son of Earth|Earth]], from the [[Molten Rock]]. He is [[Tezila]]'s brother. Ferus is the keeper of the Chapel of Fire and Earth and performs [[wedding]]s. He can also heal you if you have less than 65 [[hp]] and can remove any harmful [[Status Condition]]s.
name: Ferus

notes:
He prepares the food for all djinns in Ashta'daramai.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Djinn War - Marid Faction]].}}
sounds: Now, where was I...
name: Bo'Ques

notes:
Seymour was sent to [[Rookgaard]] to work as the town [[Librarian NPCs|librarian]] and to teach [[Newbie|newcomers]] about the [[Tibia]]n [[mainland]].
{{JSpoiler|You can trade a [[Present]], obtained in [[Present Quest]], for a [[Legion Helmet]] with him.}}
sounds: Newcomers - visit me! I'll answer your questions!
Get some training in the academy!
Feeling lost? Ask me for help!
Gain some knowledge in the academy!
name: Seymour

notes: Sells equipment of all sorts.
sounds: Come visit my little pawnshop! General equipment and such. Don't miss it!
name: Red Lilly

notes: He sells [[Item#Weapons|weapons]] that are as lethal as the bite of the desert lion and as quick as the sandwasp.
name: Habdel

notes: A Farmer in [[Stonehome]], sells some food.
sounds: Food of the finest quality! Right here!
name: James

notes: Gorn deals in different items such as [[Tools]] and [[Containers]].
sounds: General goods and paperware for sale!
name: Gorn

sounds: These are dark times.
My superiors must learn about this
This is most peculiar.
name: Torkada

notes:
It's [[Goshnar]]'s Soul wandering in [[Zarganash]]. 

{{JSpoiler|It's the main NPC of the [[Soul War Quest]].}}
name: Flickering Soul

notes:
He is responsible for supplies and trade of the colony.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[A Pirate's Tail Quest]].}}
name: Om'Wake Naha

notes: Rudolph deals in clothing.
name: Rudolph
location: East side of [[Edron]] castle, first floor up

notes:
Doubleday is a scientist and a working, contributing citizen of [[Rathleton]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Oramond Quest]].}}
name: Doubleday
location: [[Rathleton]] [[Workshop Quarter]] near the upper city ramp

notes: He is the head of a little mining operation in [[Port Hope]]. In his spare time he trains knights to prevent his old body from rusting.
name: Uso
location: North-western part of [[Port Hope]], leftmost of the depot, below the ground level in [[Port Hope Tavern]].

notes:
Offers tactical advice for the warzone.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]].}}
name: Gnomercy

notes: He warns for the danger of minotaurs and wallbreakers which might damage the factory.
name: Jossel

notes:
If you ask him he will tell you that his name is an acronym for : '''F'''loating '''R'''e'''A'''nimated '''N'''ecromantic '''S'''ervant.
His shop companion [[Digger]] doesn't seem to like him: {{Message|type=server|Digger: I think the FRANS is bugged.}}
sounds: Aaaaah... ruuunes... waaaaaands... rooooods... spellboooooks...
name: Frans
location: [[Venore]] magic shop, east of the [[depot]] and [[temple]]

notes:
Parcels are 10 [[gp]] and letters are 5 [[gp]] if the buyer has completed the [[Postman Quest]].

{{JSpoiler|He is part of [[Kissing a Pig Quest]].}}
name: Olrik
location: Post office, south of the [[depot]] in [[Underwood]]

notes:
Say '''pass''' and the destination to go through his gate.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Peter

notes: Shiantis will buy empty vials, but she does not buy empty flasks. She sells [[Football]]s but you have to ask her for one.
sounds: Containers, decoration and general goods, all here!
name: Shiantis

notes: Nelliem sells some unique tools, most of them are only buyable from him and are needed for quests.
sounds: The right tools are the secret of a green thumb.
name: Nelliem
location: West in [[Venore]], at the [[Useful Things Warehouse]].

notes: Guards the castle of [[King Tibianus III]], along with [[Harsky]]. If you swear at the king, he, together with [[Harsky]], will remove all [[Special Condition|Negative Conditions]] (poison, fire, energy etc.), attack you and leave you with only 1 hit point.
name: Stutch
location: [[Rain Castle]] throne room in north-west [[Thais]] on [[Royal Avenue]].

notes: Puffels is a spell instructor that can teach you "primitive" spells, only for premium accounts. It looks the same as a [[rat]]. Before the [[Updates/8.1|winter update 2007]] it used to teach [[Force Strike]]. Puffels wrote the book [[Magic by Puffels (Book)|Magic by Puffels]]. As of [[Updates/8.7|Update 8.7]] Puffels only teaches spells for [[Knight]]s.
name: Puffels

notes:
Say '''pass''' and the destination to go through his gate.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Tony
location: Between [[Arena and Zoo Quarter]] and [[Foreigner Quarter]]

name: Avar Tar
location: North-east of [[Edron]], near the mountain pass to the north

name: Nielson

notes:
[[File:Rashid_Big.png|thumb|right|300px]] You need to win his trust before selling any items to him. He travels to a different city everyday.

This [[NPC]] changes his location everyday.
On '''Mondays''' you can find him in [[Svargrond]], in [[Dankwart]]'s tavern, south of the temple.
On '''Tuesdays''' you can find him in [[Liberty Bay]], in [[Lyonel]]'s tavern, west of the depot.
On '''Wednesdays''' you can find him in [[Port Hope]], in [[Clyde]]'s tavern, west of the depot.
On '''Thursdays''' you can find him in [[Ankrahmun]], in [[Arito]]'s tavern, above the post office.
On '''Fridays''' you can find him in [[Darashia]], in [[Miraia]]'s tavern, south of the guildhalls.
On '''Saturdays''' you can find him in [[Edron]], in [[Mirabell]]'s tavern, above the depot.
On '''Sundays''' you can find him in [[Carlin]] depot, one floor above. {{JSpoiler|To be able to trade with him, you must complete [[The Traveling Trader Quest]].}}
name: Rashid
location: Travels around between [[Carlin]] and various [[Premium]] cities.

sounds: I'll show you the world during one of my carpet rides!
No better way to travel than on a magical carpet!
name: Ziyad

notes: '''Alberto''' can exchange your old [[Arena Badge]]s for [[potions]] and [[Drome Points]] for some exclusive items.
history: He used to be [[Burt]]'s assistant on the old [[Monster Arena]].
sounds: Drome fighters! You can trade your hard earned drome points here!
Fighters from the old arena still visit me to exchange their hard earned badges! Earned in blood that is... mostly.
name: Alberto
location: The [[Kazordoon]] [[Tibiadrome]]; access via [[Mystic Flame]] by north gate in [[The Market]], {{Mapper Coords|127.90|124.170|8|2|text=here}}.

name: Palimuth

notes:
When you are ready, The Oracle will [[teleport]] you to the [[Island of Destiny]]. The Oracle will only speak to characters that are [[level]] 8 or 9 and have confirmed the email they used for their Tibia account.
The living Oracle was killed by [[Hellgorak]], and all that remains is her spirit in this statue.
Looks like an [[Angel Statue]].
name: The Oracle

notes:
He is the commander of the "Bigfoots", the human military group that aids the [[Gnomes]]. He has a daughter, [[Allusions#Rosetta Stone|Rosetta]], who is a linguist.
{{JSpoiler|Main NPC of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]]}}
name: Commander Stone

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Primal Ordeal Quest]].}}
name: Nagging Naga

sounds: Passages to Edron, Thais, Venore, Darashia, Ankrahmun, Yalahar and Port Hope.
name: Jack Fate
location: On his ship at the [[Liberty Bay]] docks and eastern [[Goroma]]  ({{Mapper Coords|125.161|127.46|6|4|text=here}}).

notes:
Grof protects the city from [[creatures]].
{{JSpoiler|He is part of [[The Inquisition Quest]], mission 1.}}
name: Grof, The Guard
location: North gate of [[Thais]] at the intersection of [[Temple Street]] with [[Mill Avenue|Mill]] and [[Royal Avenue]].

notes: Morpel runs the Weapons Shop. [[A Grumpy Cyclops]] is his boss, although he does not like to admit it.
name: Morpel

notes: This NPC is standing in line with [[Player Level 999 (Female)]], [[Player Level 999 (Male)]], [[Player Level 1000]] and [[Player Level 1001]].
sounds: <sigh> I guess I'll go swimming.
Does someone have a pack of cards?
Hurry! Hurry!
name: Player Level 1003

notes:
He looks like an [[Iron Servant]]. He is a nonfunctional servant of the [[Mad Mage]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Elementalist Outfits Quest]].}}
name: Broken Servant Sentry

notes: Paulie is still training to be a bank clerk. He runs a bank in Rookgaard. He exchanges [[gold coin]]s, [[platinum coin]]s and [[crystal coin]]s. You can deposit and withdraw money as well as checking your account balance. However, it's not possible to deposit more than 1,000 gold coins.
sounds: Deposit your money here in the safety of the Tibian Bank!
Any questions about the functions of your bank account? Feel free to ask me for help!
name: Paulie

notes: She does not understand English, so having a conversation with her is difficult.
name: Namasa

notes: This NPC is standing in line with [[Player Level 999 (Female)]], [[Player Level 999 (Male)]], [[Player Level 1001]] and [[Player Level 1003]].
sounds: Booooring!
I should rather go and buy some cookies.
That takes ages! I'll return in five levels.
name: Player Level 1000

notes: This NPC is standing in line with [[Player Level 999 (Female)]], [[Player Level 999 (Male)]], [[Player Level 1000]] and [[Player Level 1003]].
sounds: I should have stayed on Rookgaard!
That guy already stood there when I was level 1000!
What are you waiting for?
name: Player Level 1001

notes: '''Skjaar''' asks you questions and sells you a key as part of the [[Noble Armor Quest]]. His master was [[Dago]].
name: Skjaar
location: Below [[Mount Sternum]] near the grave of his master.

notes: Tothdral is located in the library of the [[Serpentine Tower]].
name: Tothdral

notes: His full name is Albert Fibulanian. His family used to live on the isle of [[Fibula]]. Later, he was sent to [[Thais]] to learn the art of healing.
name: Albert

notes:
His full name is Nezil Whetstone, [[son of Fire]], from the [[Savage Axes]].
Nezil and his sister [[Bezil]] buy and sell [[Equipment]] to adventurers. You need to say "Hi Nezil" to talk with him, not just "Hi".
sounds: Equipment and general goods here at our shop!
name: Nezil

notes: Fillias Wayward Stokeston used to be the waterworks keeper of [[Rathleton]], but stopped because he was getting too old.
sounds: What? What? Is there anyone there? Oh. Just the wind.
Shoo! Off with you, horrible pests!
Hah. It will all end in tears, you mark my words. <mutters>
name: Fillias
location: [[Lower Rathleton]], next to the old [[Glooth Factory]]

notes:
Eleonore is the daughter of [[Percy Silverhand]]. She has lost a very special [[Eleonore Quest|ring]], and may reward you if you find it for her. Even though she's in love with [[Raymond Striker]], she doesn't respond to Raymond, but to Striker.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Eleonore Quest]].}}
name: Eleonore
location: Central [[Liberty Bay]], up in the [[Silverhand Manor]].

notes: He is a lover of rum. He also finds [[Isolde]] pretty and polite. He thinks down of several other cities and their inhabitants. Cedrik believes [[Quara]] will be the doom of [[Liberty Bay]] by Tibians being unsure of their numbers they might make an assault on the town all at once to wipe Liberty Bay from the map.
sounds: Support your local weapon dealer!
name: Cedrik
location: In [[Liberty Bay]], north of tavern, west of temple.

notes: {{JSpoiler|He is part of the [[Kissing a Pig Quest]], you need to be very drunk to talk to him.}}
name: Toothless Tim

notes:
He may be in need of some help.
If you say "crystal pedestal" to him he will buy all pedestals in any colour state in your [[inventory]].
{{JSpoiler| Main NPC of [[Shadows of Yalahar Quest]].
Part of [[The New Frontier Quest]]. }}
name: Telas
location: Just south-west of [[Stonehome]], in his house

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Opticording Sphere Quest]].}}
name: Deepling Idol

notes:
His full name is Nicholas Cavendish. He trades in [[furniture]], but also designs it himself.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Gloud Ship]] mission.}}
sounds: The newest items from Venore! Finest tapestries, lamps and clocks!
Hand-crafted timeless design from the very best in Rathleton!
name: Nicholas

notes: This NPC has many mystic runes, power fluids, spellbooks and other magic equipment, for example rods for druids or wands for sorcerers.
name: Shiriel
location: First floor above ground north and west of [[Depot]] in [[Treetop]]

sounds: One lump or two, old chap?
Now now. There's enough tea for everyone.
Splendid, old chap
But where are my manners? Have another cup.
Leopold! I think your jawbone just dropped into your cup!
Isn't that a pip?
Why don't you drop me a line some time?
name: Solkrin (NPC)

notes:
There are six [[Repenter]]s found at [[Repenter Camp|their camp]] in [[Hellgate]]. Once greeted, they will ask you to talk to [[Ashari]] and end the conversation.
They use the same outfit, but with different hair colors:
{{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=95|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}} {{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=21|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}} {{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=60|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}} {{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=38|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}} {{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=58|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}} {{Outfitter|outfit=101|c1=2|c2=22|c3=22|c4=20|height=64|width=64}}
name: Repenter

sounds: Selling potions for humans and poison for undead creatures.
