notes:
He says he'd rather be an [[Actor NPCs|actor]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Thieves Guild Quest]], mission 6.}}
name: Herbert

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[The Dream Courts Quest]].}}
name: Vanys

sounds: I wish I could learn more about this strange world.
Those different cultures are amazing.
What an interesting continent.
name: Cael
location: [[Farmine]], north of the steamship and armory.

notes: Flying carpet pilot for Kazordoon. She will also sell you tickets to use the Kazordoon ore wagon system.
sounds: Nothing beats the feeling of flying with a carpet!
name: Gewen

notes: Djema is an orphan. She was adopted by [[Gabel]] and the other [[Djinn|Marid]] when she was a child. She is excited every time she meets another human.
name: Djema

sounds: Feel the wind in your hair during one of my carpet rides!
name: Pino
location: [[Edron]] castle, directly above the north city gate

sounds: A gem is not a rock! Don't just play with it.
This place could need some more green.
What was that...?!
'Do the night shift' they said. 'It will pay off' they said.
I swear it's darker down here during nights, hmpf.
Night shift. Again!
name: Gnome Guard Captain

notes: Garamond Starstream teaches Sorcerer and Druid spells, depending on your vocation, for free but they are temporary while on Dawnpost.
name: Garamond

notes: He specialises in things from [[Otherworld|other dimensions]].
name: Fadil
location: In the [[Darashia Palace]], between the mana shop and bank, on [[Darashia Street]]

notes: He pays the most for [[bow]]s and [[crossbow]]s.
sounds: Equipment and general goods!
Selling ammunition and buying bows and crossbows!
name: Timur

notes:
He is the commander of the [[Gnomes]] at [[Gnomebase Alpha]] and he gives missions to Bigfoot recruits.
{{JSpoiler|Important NPC of the [[Bigfoot's Burden Quest]]. Gives you all the Major and Major Plus gnome tasks, starting with Matchmaker and Repair when you gain rank 2, and then the Grindstone and Spore task when you gain rank 3.}}
name: Gnomeral

notes: Lothar is a hermit who lives in his house with a tamed [[Stampor]] called [[Arkarra]]. He can tell you all about every taming item.
sounds: I enjoy the peace and solitude out here. You're welcome to be my guest as long as you behave in a quiet and tolerable manner.
name: Lothar

notes:
Arkhothep is the dark pharaoh that rules the undead city of Ankrahmun. The pharaoh is both the high priest and the primary deity of an obscure cult that celebrates the undead as the key to immortality. As the pharaoh is a busy (un-)man, he leaves many of his duties, including [[Promotion]]s, in the hands of his second in command, Grand Vizier [[Ishebad]]. The pharaoh has filled the basement of his own palace with skeletons and other undead creatures, so that those who are still mortal can see the glory of being undead for themselves. He was summoned [[Arkhothep (Creature)|as a creature]] in Ankrahmun on the Winter Test Server of 2006, as well as the Summer Test Servers of 2010 and 2012.
Although his room is [[Unreachable Locations|inaccessible]], there was a screenshot displaying it on [https://www.tibia.com/abouttibia/?subtopic=screenshots Tibia.com's Screenshots section] for years. Two versions of such screenshot com be seen below. Arkhothep Old Screenshot 1.jpg Arkhothep Old Screenshot 2.jpg
name: Arkhothep
location: On the top of the central pyramid on [[Ankrahmun]].

notes:
Quentin resides in the [[Thais]] [[Temple]]. He can heal you up to 65 [[hp]] and can also remove any harmful [[Status Condition]]s.
{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Blessed Stake Quest]].}}
name: Quentin
location: [[Thais]] [[Temple]] at [[Temple Street|Temple]] and [[Main Street]]s, just south and east of [[depot]], in middle of town.

sounds: Buy bows, crossbows and ammunition here!
Bows! Crossbows! Bolts and arrows! Buy them here!
name: Isika

notes:
He is recruiting people to stop a new danger threatening [[Rookgaard]].
{{JSpoiler|Main [[NPC]] of [[The Rookie Guard Quest]].}}
sounds: Talk to me if you want to help protecting the village.
Rookgaard needs your help more than ever.
name: Vascalir

notes:
Grants access to [[Rise of Devovorga]] bosses in exchange for [[Tentacle Piece]]s. Looks like a [[Guardian Statue]].
* [[Anmothra]] - 2 pieces
* [[Teneshpar]] - 8 pieces
* [[Irahsae]] - 5 pieces
* [[Phrodomo]] - 16 pieces
* [[Chikhaton]] - 12 pieces
name: Dread Guardian

notes: Fynn is a [[Barbarian]]. He protects the town from outside dangers. Ask him about the town and any shops and he can tell you where to go and who to look for.
name: Fynn

notes: She rules [[Issavi]]. If you talk to her without having been granted an audience, she will kick you out of the palace.{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Kilmaresh Quest]].}}
sounds: Rulership is a duty as well as a burden.
I am worrying about the Fafnar cultists. I am sure they are up to something.
It has been a long time since I have spoken to Arishum. I should invite him or pay him a visit. I miss our conversations.
name: The Empress

notes:
He shouts messages to the town, particularly those to do with [[quests]]. Apart from these fixed messages, he will also inform you of currently active [[Mini World Changes]].

When greeting him, he'll promptly tell you that he is too busy to talk with you.
sounds: Hear me! Hear me! The mage Wyrdin in the Edron academy is looking for brave adventurers to undertake a task!
Hear me! Hear me! The postmaster's guild has open spots for aspiring postmen! Contact Kevin Postner at the post office in the plains south of Kazordoon!
Hear me! Hear me! The inquisition is looking for daring people to fight evil! Apply at the inquisition headquarters next to the Thaian jail!
name: Towncryer
location: [[Thais]], around the depot and docks at [[Harbour Street|Harbour]] and [[Main Street]].

notes: Asima assists [[Shalmar]] by selling magical goods, so that he can focus on teaching spells.
name: Asima

notes: He's [[Knight Hykrion]]'s assistant and you can therefore only reach him if you choose "knight" as your vocation. When talking to him, he'll give you a [[weapon]] of your choice ([[Daramian Mace]], [[Steel Axe]] or [[Jagged Sword]]).
name: Weaponmaster
location: One floor down in the Knight's building on the [[Island of Destiny]]

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Dangerous Depths Quest]].}}
sounds: Hm hm.
I really wonder what takes them so long...
Not long and all this uncharted territory will be us. Ah, a gnome can dream...
Where are the reinforcements?
name: Gnomus

notes: '''Burt''' is the supervisor of the [[Monster Arena]] and therefore has to take care of its fighters.
sounds: If you got to fight, you got to fight!
Rotworms!
name: Burt
location: The [[Kazordoon]] [[Monster Arena]]; access via [[Mystic Flame]] by north gate in [[The Market]], {{Mapper Coords|127.90|124.170|8|2|text=here}}.

notes: The assistant NPC during the [[Pantibian Festival]].
sounds: Free stuff! Check it out!
name: Festival Assistant

sounds: Passages to Tibia, Folda and Vega.
name: Anderson

sounds: Oh my, such a mess! I really should clean up things more often.
Laaa Laaa LaLa Laa Laaa!
name: Gnomegica

notes: Norbert deals in [[Armor]].
sounds: Wonderful and stylish clothes! Come and buy!
name: Norbert

sounds: Heya. Furniture on sale! Don't miss the opportunity.
name: Peggy
location: Central [[Liberty Bay]], north-west of depot, north of [[Cedrik]].

notes: Morun is a protector of the people of [[Darashia]].
name: Morun
location: The entrance to the Caliph's chambers in the [[Darashia]] castle, one floor up.

notes:
Spectulus is an inventor and scientist, and wants to unveil the secrets of the stars. He needs help to construct a strange device and has A LOT of tasks and missions for you.
{{JSpoiler|Main [[NPC]] of the [[Sea of Light Quest]], [[Jack to the Future Quest]] and [[Liquid Black Quest]].}}
sounds: Precisely.
So my initial calculations had been correct!
Looks like I have to find another way then.
Hm, I need to recapitulate my equipment...
name: Spectulus
location: [[Edron]] [[Ivory Towers]], top floor of the center tower

notes:
She performs [[wedding]]s for [[Tibia]] [[character]]s.
There are some pickable [[flowers]] near her: a [[Moon Flower]], [[Orange Star]], [[Red Rose]], [[Tulip]], [[Goat Grass]], and [[Blue Rose]].
name: Llathriel

notes: Sells [[Potions]], [[Runes]] and [[Distance Weapons]]. Buys [[Creature Products]] dropped by [[Roshamuul]] Demons.
name: Asnarus

sounds: Whoah. That was a large shadow passing by.
name: Captain Max
location: [[Liberty Bay]] on one of the eastern [[Boat]]s at the dock ({{Mapper Coords|126.42|128.128|6|4|text=here}}), and on a boat above [[Calassa]] ({{Mapper Coords|124.171|127.197|6|4|text=here}}).

notes:
He is a lizard priest who needs help to fight against the dragonkin wreaking havoc behind the mountains, on the so-called [[Muggy Plains]]. He claims to receive visions from his deity The Great Snake.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Children of the Revolution Quest]] and the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]]. At the end of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]], you will kill him and thereby make his small room on the [[Zao Steppe]] inaccessible.}}
sounds: I mourn my lozzt brozzerzz and zzizzterzz. May zzeir zzoulzz find peazze.
Great mozzer, how long until you zztrike and show zzem?
Uzzelezz. Uzzelezz!
name: Zalamon

notes:
Aruda is a wily young woman who wanders around [[Thais]]. She attracts young men to herself so that she may steal from them. All people beware for once you talk to her she will quickly take your [[GP|money]] and run. Note, her name's similarity with the word "rude".
Some rumours suggest that she may be a powerful magic user.
According to [[Oswald]], she used to be the girlfriend of [[Partos]], who is also a thief. When she says ''"Oh, sorry, I was distracted, what did you say?"'', that means she has stolen gold from you (up to 10[[gp]]). If you don't have any gold OR call her a thief, she'll say ''"Oh sorry, I have to hurry, bye!"
If you say "time" and look at your watch, she will then steal your watch. '''Warning: Be careful! If Aruda is close by (within 4 squares) of an NPC and you say hi, she will still steal your gold!'''
sounds: Hey there, up for a chat?
name: Aruda

notes:
Neill McNeill teaches players how to do close combat fighting with the [[Mean Knight Sword]].
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Child of Destiny Quest]].}}
sounds: Come, one and all! Come and enjoy our grand festival!
Enter our tents and choose your destiny!
Close quarter combat, swords and shields! Have at it!
Rookies! Initiates! Friends! Lend me your ears!
name: Neill
location: [[Island of Destiny]], before the first tent

notes: Aldo deals in [[Helmets]], [[Legs]] and [[Boots]]. He isn't happy in his work, he just doesn't like it, the same with his whole life. He will also repair [[Worn Soft Boots]] for 10,000 gold.

name: Aldo
location: At the [[Dress for Success Warehouse]] in [[Venore]], south-east from the [[depot]].

notes: Sells equipment you may need on the mainland and buys equipment you will no longer need from [[Rookgaard]], you can also access your bank account at him.
sounds: Get your shovels, ropes and torches here!
Do you need health potions, young knight? All the potions you could wish for are here!
Aaaaaall basic equipment for your adventure at Raffael's!
If you don't want to spend your money, I can also deposit it on your bank account for you. Or even better, withdraw it so you can shop!
Lost in the dark and out of mana to cast a light spell? Buy a torch now!
Cheapest offers on the whole island! - Well, the only offers!
Special offers for premium customers!
Don't leave for mainland without stopping by!
name: Raffael

notes: She is the head [[sorcerer]] of the [[guild]], even over [[Muriel]]. She wanders amongst the bookshelves above the [[Sorcerer]]'s Guild. She is studying the ways of the ancestors and doesn't want to be disturbed.
name: Lungelen

notes: Olm holds a lot of information about the island of [[Oramond]] and its city of [[Rathleton]].
name: Olm

notes:
Say '''pass''' and the destination to go through his gate.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[In Service of Yalahar Quest]].}}
name: Reed

notes:
She wants to keep the nature balanced, so if you find a [[Starving Wolf]] you should capture it and bring it to her so she can take care of it.
{{JSpoiler|A part of the [[Overhunting]] World Change.}}
sounds: Nature is in pain.
The weather is fine today.
I can hear the call of the forest.
name: Benevola

notes:
Chavis takes care of [[Rathleton]]'s poor.
{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Oramond Quest]].}}
name: Chavis

notes: She helps newcomers find their way in [[Venore]] by marking important places such as the [[Depot]] and the [[Bank]] in the players' automap and escorting players to the [[Depot]].
sounds: Free escort to the depot for newcomers!
Talk to me if you need directions.

Whoever reaches the switch plate first ignites a [[Coal Basin]] above and wins. He and his rival are known as "The Fast and the Furious", which is an [[Allusions#The Fast and the Furious|allusion]] to the film series [[wikipedia:The Fast and the Furious|The Fast and the Furious]].

He thinks [[Isolde]] is not only beautiful but also valorous and honourable. Her pure heart is a living temple for the gods. Her eyes are the gates to heaven. Her smile is the warmth of spring after a hard winter. Every soul is touched by the melody of her sweet voice. This is an 
allusion to the famous opera "[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tristan_und_Isolde Tristan Und Isolde]"

<sigh> So much to do, so little time...

notes: None.

I could do with a break...
<grumble> Work, work, work...
<grumble> A slave driver, that's what he is.

notes:
She helps newcomers find their way around [[Yalahar]] by marking important places such as the [[Depot]] and the [[Bank]] in the players' automap and escorting players to the [[Depot]].

Thinks [[Thais]] is not the city it used to be, too many people, too noisy and too dirty.Her comments about [[Venore]]: "Those haggling and scheming merchants sometimes give me more shivers than a demon. notes:

sounds: Ah, nothing inspires an actress like the sight of the sparkling ocean.

notes: Willow is a druid apprentice of [[Salbra]], about his name he says "''I am called that because it is my favourite tree. A gentle creature is the [[Willow|willow tree]], and the wind sings in its boughs.''"

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Primal Ordeal Quest]].}}

notes: Runs a fruits and vegetables shop.

Oh dear, I can't find anything in here!

Jane!

notes:

{{JSpoiler|Part of [[The Blessed Stake Quest]].}}
sounds: Please, not so loud, not so loud. Some of us are trying to rest in peace here.

A book in The [[Isle of the Kings]] refers to her as a follower of [[Zathroth]] and that she makes a special potions for his minions.
{{JSpoiler| Part of the [[Blood Herb Quest]].
Part of [[Bored Mini World Change]].
Part of [[What a Foolish Quest]], mission 10. }}

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[The Dream Courts Quest]].}}

Ah, the mysteries of the living and the dead.

notes: He supplies the city with equipment. Brother of [[Al Dee]] who works in Rookgaard also as a Equipment Shopkeeper. He may be related to [[Barnabas Dee]], sorcerer from Rathleton. His name appears to be a pun referring to 'Greedy'. This NPC yells often and it may become annoying, he can be permanently ignored and his yells will no longer get to you, while you would still be able to talk with him in the NPC channel.
sounds: Buy my wares!
Come and buy at a cheap rate!
Feel FREE to buy my ITEMS!

location: [[Yalahar]], west side of the main street, north of the depot, second floor.

notes: Sells and buys gems and jewelry. She also runs the bank in [[Svargrond]]. She exchanges [[Gold Coin]]s, [[Platinum Coin]]s and [[Crystal Coin]]s. You can deposit, withdraw, and transfer money as well as checking your account balance.
sounds: Gems, jewels... all a woman could dream of is right here.
Leave your money with me where it's safe!

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Glooth Factory Quest]] - ''Glooth Bandits'' mission.}}

notes: He was imprisoned by the [[Ogres]] to serve as an example to the other goblins working in the [[Krailos Mines]]. He says his real name was lost in sorrow, and that he took on the name ''Garamor Avolok Tor-Mazak'' (which roughly translated means ''Black Veil on Mind, Shadow on Heart, Tears of Blood, Weeping for Thousands Killed by Greed'') to suit the tragic fate of the goblins on [[Krailos]] better.{{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Krailos Quest]].}}

Billy, along with his brother [[Willie]], runs the mill that spans the line between the free and premium sides of Rookgaard. Billy works on the premium side, buying and selling various foods.
He is known for his [[Wikipedia:Profanity|foul language]]. If you walk away from him without saying "bye", he will call you names when you are out of range.
Billy wants to make some of his famous stew, but he needs dead [[Rat]]s and a [[Pan]]. {{JSpoiler|Main [[NPC]] of the [[Small Health Potion Quest]].}}

Argh, if I only had a pan!

Buying fresh dead rats!
Buying many types of food and ingredients, too!
Hmm, hmm, now which ingredients do I need...

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Dark Trails Quest]].}}

notes:
'''Yana O'Reilly''' is a token trader at the [[Adventurer's Guild]]. In order to buy her items, ask about '''gold''' tokens. She could charge your weapon with its special type for either 5, 10 or 15 [[Gold Token]]s '''till the [[Updates/11.40|Summer Update 2017]]'''; the more tokens you used to charge it the higher the risk of it breaking. Since then, she will trade [[Gold Token]]s for items necessary for [[Imbuing]]. 

Since the Winter Update 2017 the Mayhem, Remedy and Carving weapons were combined into weapons of Destruction.

Please note that despite the Sell list, she will only give you the respective [[Creature Products]] necessary for the imbuements, you will still need to imbue the item regularly and the usual restrictions apply.

Yana is [[Cledwyn]]'s cousin. Unlike her, he collects [[Silver Token]]s. Yana also mentions that her name means "prudence or cunningness in some old Tibian language". It might be derived from the same language [[Yasir]] speaks, as he replies with "Soso yana. <shakes his head>" when the player requests a passage.
sounds: Trading tokens! First-class equipment available!
name: Yana

notes:
A special [[Events|event]] NPC that was introduced [[Updates/10.41|May 31st, 2014]]. He handed out a [[Green Light]] to every Tibian who greeted him. He remained in tibia for about two weeks.
On [[Updates/12.86.11871 (2)|Update 12.86.11871]] the NPC was reintroduced with the launch of [[Tibia Observer]] app, this time handing out an [[Observer Tapestry]].
history: When first introduced in [[Updates/10.41|2014]] his outfit had these colors : https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/tibia/images/b/bb/Gaberiel.gif/revision/20220428224506/scale-to-width-down/120?path-prefix=en&format=original
sounds: Get your green light!

He doesn't trust his chief, [[Abran Ironeye]].
sounds: Selling bows, crossbows and ammunition!

notes:

He makes [[Postman Quest/Spoiler#Mission 9 - New Uniforms|uniforms]]. Hugo Chief (his full name) is clearly an [[Allusions#Hugo Boss|allusion]] to the famous brand Hugo Boss.
{{JSpoiler|He is part of [[The Postman Missions Quest]] and talks about the [[Beggar Outfit]] to premium accounts.}}
sounds: Ahh! A vision! I have a vision for a new outfit! Assistant, some paper, fast!

location: [[Venore]], upstairs in the [[Dress for Success Warehouse]].

notes:
The Blind Orc is the only seller of bows and arrows on [[Rookgaard]] which are needless to buy if you are not planning to stay on [[Rookgaard]].

To be able to communicate and trade with him you need to be able to speak the [[Orc Language]]. If you do not speak this tongue there might be some other [[Rookgaard NPCs|people]] in the village that can teach you.

To reach the blind orc, go down the main Rookgaard dungeon ({{Mapper Coords|125.93|125.138|7|3|text=here}}) and rope up the first rope spot you find to the east. From there it is a one-way path with a few [[Poison Spider]]s and [[Orc]]s.

Carlson

{{JSpoiler|You need talk to him in the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].}}

Come in and order one of my deliciousss mealsss. How about pan-fried lobssster with roasssted coconut riccce and a glassss of mango juiccce?
Come in and order one of my deliciousss mealsss. How about sssauteed ssstarleaf and ssscrambled turtle eggsss with coconut bread?

notes:
He says that he was once called Bejorn, but that everyone calls him Buddel now. Buddel will take you to some of the ice islands for 50 [[Currency|gold]], valid destinations are [[Tyrsung]], [[Okolnir]], [[Svargrond]], [[Barbarian Settlements|Camp]] and [[Helheim]].
But beware! This NPC is always [[Drunk NPCs|drunk]] so it is highly likely he will take you to wrong places. Bringing a [[Dwarven Ring]] in your backpack makes him take you to the right spot but you lose the ring. When the [[Dwarven Ring]] is used you also don't have to pay the 50 [[Currency|gold]]. '''Note: you only will be able to travel with him after you have completed the [[Barbarian Test Quest]].''' There are two ways to prevent him from taking a [[Dwarven Ring]] you may be carrying: * The first and easiest way is to just tell him "no" when he offers to take it. (Note: this is the only way to prevent him from taking a [[Dwarven Ring]] if you have more than one with you). * The second way, if you carry just a single [[Dwarven Ring]], is to equip it in your ring slot. He won't take it then.
name: Buddel
location: South of [[Svargrond]], [[Tyrsung]] ({{Mapper Coords|126.76|121.254|7|3|text=here}}), [[Okolnir]] ({{Mapper Coords|125.224|122.150|7|3|text=here}}), [[Barbarian Settlements]] ({{Mapper Coords|125.20|122.62|7|3|text=here}}) and [[Helheim]] ({{Mapper Coords|126.209|121.198|7|3|text=here}}).

notes:
Ned Nobel sells [[Fireworks Rocket]]s to celebrate the new year.
He claims to be the son of [[Allusions#Alfred Nobel|Alfred Nobel]].
history:
This [[NPC]] first appeared during [[Tibia's 10th Anniversary]] in [[Edron]], but he left the continent when the party ended. He gave you a (limited) amount of free [[Fireworks Rocket]]s, [[Party Hat]]s, [[Party Trumpet]]s and other [[Party Item]]s, up to around 22.
To get an item, you needed to greet him and say "item". Ned used to end the conversation every time you got an item, so you needed to greet him again.

His location used to vary during the new year's season:
He first appears in [[Ab'Dendriel]], north of entrance.
Then he will be in [[Carlin]], south of depot.
Then he will be in [[Kazordoon]], south of castle.
Then he will be in [[Liberty Bay]], west of depot.
Then he will be in [[Edron]], south of entrance.
Then he will be in [[Thais]], east of boat. After new year's season he leaves Tibia.
sounds: A prosperous new year!
Rockits for everyone! Come and have some fun!
name: Ned Nobel

notes: {{JSpoiler|Part of the [[Wrath of the Emperor Quest]].}}
name: Gate Guardian

notes: Guards the [[Emperor Kruzak]], along with [[Hemor, The Guard]].

Shoot your enemy with energy spheres!

Part of [[The Traveling Trader Quest]], fifth mission. Part of the [[Obsidian Knife Quest]].}}
sounds: By the sons of fire! Best weapons in town!
name: Uzgod

It looks like a [[Knight_Statue_(Object)|Knight Statue]].

I can help you, just come over here.
Only the best for you.

notes: Buys and sells equipment.

notes:

{{JSpoiler| *Take a [[Lyre]] and visit Edala (top floor of the [[Suntower]] near [[Ab'dendriel]]). *Play the [[Lyre]] while standing in front of Edala and the next thing you should do is say "Hi" to her. *Edala will say she is pleased you are taking an interest in music. *Now wait 24 hours (1 day) and repeat exactly what you have just done. Each day Edala will say something different in response to you playing the [[Lyre]] for her, each progressively less amicable than the last. Until, the 6th day when Edala is tired of hearing you play and offers you a [[Diapason]] to go away. *Each character is only able to receive one [[Diapason]].}}

I know the ways and lays of Dawnport. Talk to me if you want to know more!
Hello, there! New here? I can help!
Feeling lost? Why not go out on a hunt or quest!
Come to me if you need directions!
Buying all sorts of creature products!
Troll hair, wolf fur, lumps of dirt - bring them to me!

Dorbin explains he has to keep a close eye on him as he cause all the destruction that is visible throughout the house. You should put this NPC on permanent ignore if his yells bother you.

sounds: Passages to Carlin, Venore and Thais.

notes: '''Edgar-Ellen''' was implemented in order to recite the winning poems from the {{OfficialNewsArchive|3809|''It's Time to Rhyme'' contest}}.
sounds: Orshabaal was out of his maze to make us suffer for many days. In Calmera, a knight with blue beard from his hideout appeared. He fought bravely supported by mages, the demon ran and is gone for ages.

A knight from Guardia needed Chayenne's key. His friend dropped the item on the floor, hoping no one would see. But, at the same moment, a man crossed their way and all the knight's dreams faded away.
A knight from Candia was dining at Frodo's hut, devouring plates full of meat and whatnot. Suddenly, he was called to fight. He wanted to put his armor on but it was too tight.
The druid entered a Premian pyramid intent on the kill, 'Oh, that djinn will die, it will!' Down and up the stairs she hopped like a cat... When, Oops! She moved the wrong way, and died a drunk rat.
Hoping to find a strange orc in his spawn, a Zaneran knight logged on before dawn. A sudden heart attack left him surprised as Sam's old backpack he had recognised.
The world I shall save', an Olympian knight proclaimed! But from a visit to the bar he could not abstain! He woke up in pain, it all was in vain. From Venorian beer he will forever refrain.
During the dark and scary night, when others sleep he goes to fight, banishing demons, that feels right, purging the evil on the sight, fearlessly waiting for daylight, Zeluna's bravest elite knight.
A druid from Celesta once talked with a girl, he even bought her a necklace with a huge white pearl. Every time he went home, without money and fame, I guess this girl is cursed, Aruda is the name.

A story of a knight untold, on Rowana the dice she rolled. She lured players from afar. Who could resist a shining star? She promised gold and many items, then stole their heart with cunning kindness.
Do you think it's just a game? Don't you fear the dragon's flame? If you are as brave as bright, if you do not stray from fight, you may want to hear tonight, the tale of Guardia's lonely knight.
For a knight from Yanara 10,000 gold were a lot. So he ventured with a team into the desert to win that pot. He solved all the riddles, strongly willed. But on his journey home he sadly was killed.
A great mage from Celesta went dungeon down deep, he was very brave but his wand was cheap. Among white skeletons one of them was red. Last what he saw were the words: 'You are dead!'
A young sorcerer born and raised on Astera when dragons were scary, it was that kind of era. Walking all the way to the city of Venore, he stole from the dwarven bridge nothing less than an iron ore.
A druid from Eternia just bought his first boots of haste, to finally have his leather boots replaced. Catching a backpack of fish was now his dream, but he ended up swinging his new boots upstream.
A sorcerer from Efidia took his horse and got it saddled, and set out for battle. His horse lost control and threw him into a hole. Now his team lost all hope, because he forgot to bring a rope.
A knight in Guardia was feeling bored. He wanted to show a dragon lord the taste of his new carlin sword. To its lair then he did go. But before he saw his foe, he met his end by a one hit K.O.
On Secura a confident knight levelled to main, 840 rats he had slain. 'I am going to kill dragons,' he said while pounding his breastplate. The next thing he saw was: 'You have met a sad fate.'
One morning frosty fresh and nice, a knight was fishing on the ice. Catching some pikes for soup, but a dire penguin ate his loot. His angry wife said in the house: Now whole Beneva will laugh at us!
A paladin slaying dragons on Antica's soil, when a lord charges on to make the adventurer's blood boil. It puts up a strong fight, but to no avail. It gets slain and drops a dragon scale mail!
Through Rookgaard's sewer there swarmed no fewer than a hundred screeching rats. Wading through mud, and covered in blood, two young men fought back-to-back. To Trimera's end; a knight, and a friend.
name: Edgar-Ellen

notes:
He claims to be a poor merchant, bad at trading, having four or five wives and dozens of kids to feed. See also [[:File:Goblinmerchant.jpg|an official artwork of Rafzan]]. To reach him, you need to stand in an [[Elevator]] and use a [[Winch]] to the right of the elevator.

Target locked.

She is a trader and sell gems, jewelry and goblets. She thinks that [[Liberty Bay]] is a horrible little town, everything and everyone that is native smells like fish. As far as she understands, sugar is quite important. She thinks that [[sorcerer]]s are horrible people.

notes: You must have a [[Premium]] account to trade with him.
sounds: Any time's a good time to buy some furniture!

notes:
Hans Gender was first spotted by players on July 21, 2021. Because of its weird dialogs (mostly a copy of [[Vigintius]]') and location, it was presumed that the NPC was not supposed to be there. This theory was later {{Post|39213025|confirmed}} by CipSoft which stated the error would be fixed. Hans Gender was removed from the game two days later on [[Updates/12.70.10974|July 23]].

One possible explanation for Hans Gender's existence is that it's work in progress related to the celebrations of Tibia's 25th Anniversary, which should take place in January, 2022. It's likely that [[Vigintius]] was used as a template since it's also related to these festivities, but Hans Gender was mistakenly left in an area accessible by players.
sounds: Mysterious inscription underneath Thais discovered! Member of Explorer Society still missing!
Wanna dig for some treasures? Grab your shovel or buy one here!
Come here, buy some tasty food and drinks!
Enjoy the festivities here on Vigintia Island!
name: Hans Gender

sounds: Behold the makings of the Shapers!
I wonder how papa does...
Imbuing means to do the Shapers' will!

Rwarrr.
